0.title: What multiple records did England break against Pakistan today?
0.article_body: England became the first-ever side to score 500 runs on Day 1 of a Test by aggregating 506/4 against Pakistan today. Four players slammed centuries on opening day of a match for the first time. England's Zak Crawley and Ben Duckett shared 233-run stand in 35.4 overs, recording the highest run-rate in opening partnership of 200+ runs in Test cricket.

1.title: Bigger rats will emerge in Bengal teachers' scam: Calcutta HC judge
1.article_body: Calcutta High Court's judge Abhijit Gangopadhyay on Thursday said that bigger rats involved in the West Bengal teachers' recruitment scam case will emerge during the course of investigation. Last month, he said he wonders whether the real masterminds behind the multi-crore scam will be nabbed during his lifetime. TMC leader Manik Bhattacharya was earlier arrested in connection with the case.

2.title: US Prez Biden greets France's Macron with military guard of honour
2.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Thursday greeted French President Emmanuel Macron with a military guard of honour at the White House. "France is our oldest ally, our unwavering partner in freedom's cause," Biden said. Referring to the Ukraine war, Macron, who is on a state visit to the US, said it was vital the two countries remained united.

3.title: China announces easing of COVID-19 restrictions in some cities
3.article_body: A number of Chinese cities eased COVID-19 restrictions on Thursday, days after protests across the country against the stringent regulations. Shijiazhuang in the north, Guangzhou in the south and Chengdu in the southwest were among some of the cities to announce easing of testing requirements and restrictions on movement. On Thursday, the Chinese government reported 36,061 new COVID-19 cases.

4.title: SpiceJet repaid ₹15 cr out of ₹100 cr loan amount to City Union Bank
4.article_body: SpiceJet paid ₹15 crore out of the ₹100 crore loaned to it by Tamil Nadu-based City Union Bank (CUB), said N Kamakodi, MD and CEO, CUB. SpiceJet provided a monthly schedule till June 2023 and has been making payments in accordance with it, he added. Earlier this year, the airline had pledged two crore shares with CUB as collateral.

5.title: What is the country-wise distribution of players in IPL auction long list?
5.article_body: A total of 991 players have signed up to be part of the upcoming IPL auction. Out of the 991 players, 714 are Indians, while the remaining players have registered from 14 other countries. As many as 57 cricketers from Australia have registered for the auction, followed by South Africa (52), West Indies (33) and England (31).

6.title: Elon Musk's friend Pranay Pathole's Twitter account gets suspended briefly
6.article_body: The Twitter account of Pranay Pathole, an engineer from India who has met Elon Musk in person and whose tweets often received a response from Musk himself, was suspended briefly on Thursday. When a Twitter user pointed out that Pathole's account was suspended, Musk responded, "Digging into this now." Earlier in an interview, Pathole had described Musk as "super friendly".

7.title: Former Chinese Prez Jiang Zemin's memorial meeting on December 6
7.article_body: The memorial meeting for former Chinese President Jiang Zemin, who died on Wednesday, will be held in Beijing on December 6. The meeting will be held in the Great Hall of the People and will be telecast live, according to an announcement from Comrade Jiang Zemin's Funeral Committee headed by President Xi Jinping. Zemin had died of leukaemia, aged 96.

8.title: RP is my co-actor Ram Pothineni, wasn't aware Rishabh Pant is known as RP: Urvashi
8.article_body: Urvashi Rautela, while speaking about link-up controversy surrounding cricketer Rishabh Pant, said she had no idea people would misinterpret things. "RP is my co-actor and stands for Ram Pothineni. I was not even aware that Rishabh Pant is also known as RP," she stated. "People just assume stuff and write about it," Urvashi further said.

9.title: HC allows TMC to hold rally near Suvendu Adhikari's house in Bengal
9.article_body: The Calcutta High Court allowed the TMC to hold a rally near the residence of BJP's Suvendu Adhikari in West Bengal on December 3. Adhikari moved the High Court challenging the permission granted for the rally, nearly 100 metres from his residence, claiming it'll affect the peace there. The court said the rally should be held without causing public inconvenience.

10.title: Services at Mumbai airport's Terminal 2 restored after server crash
10.article_body: Services at Mumbai airport's Terminal 2 have been restored after a damaged wire caused a server crash. The crash, which forced airport authorities to switch to manual check-ins, caused a delay in departure of some flights at the airport. The crash was caused after a network cable was cut due to "ongoing work elsewhere in Mumbai", the airport's operator said.

11.title: RBI announces 4-tiered regulatory framework for Urban Co-operative Banks
11.article_body: Reserve Bank of India on Thursday announced a four-tiered regulatory framework for categorisation of Urban Co-operative Banks (UCBs). UCBs having deposits up to ₹100 crore were categorised into Tier 1, while Tier 2 comprises UCBs with deposits over ₹100 crore and up to ₹1,000 crore. Tier 3 will cover banks with deposits over ₹1,000 crore and up to ₹10,000 crore.

12.title: Sanjay Kumar takes charge as Secy of Dept of School Education & Literacy
12.article_body: IAS officer Sanjay Kumar took charge as Secretary of the Department of School Education and Literacy, Ministry of Education, in Shastri Bhawan in Delhi on Thursday. Kumar has replaced IAS officer Anita Karwal, who was superannuated on Wednesday. Kumar, a 1990-batch IAS officer of Bihar cadre, is an ex-Secretary of Department of Youth Affairs, Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports.

13.title: Big issue: France's Macron as Musk relaxes Twitter's content rules
13.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron criticised Elon Musk's decision to relax Twitter's content moderation policies around subjects like coronavirus disinformation. Calling it a "big issue", Macron said, "You can have free speech, you can write what you want, but there are responsibilities and limits." Macron added that he believes Twitter needs more regulation.

14.title: Punjab police constable booked for glorifying weapons in YouTube song
14.article_body: A Punjab Police constable, who's also a singer, was booked by the Moga Police for allegedly glorifying gun culture in a track he uploaded on YouTube, an official said. The move comes after Punjab DGP on November 26 said state residents had 72 hours to remove content promoting gun culture from social media, following which criminal action would be taken.

15.title: Shah Rukh Khan performs Umrah in Mecca, pictures go viral
15.article_body: Photos of Shah Rukh Khan have surfaced on social media where the actor is seen praying in the holy city of Mecca. In the photos which have been posted by fan pages, the actor is seen surrounded by people. He wore a white garment as he performed Umrah. The actor recently announced wrap-up of the Saudi Arabia schedule of 'Dunki'.

16.title: Morocco reach knockout stage of FIFA World Cup after 36 years
16.article_body: Morocco on Thursday defeated Canada 2-1 in their last Group F match to qualify for 2022 FIFA World Cup round of 16. Morocco finished on top of their group with seven points from three matches. Morocco have reached the knockout stage of FIFA World Cup for the first time after 36 years and for the second time in their history.

17.title: UK to use Starlink to trial providing high-speed internet in remote areas
17.article_body: United Kingdom will trial using low Earth orbit satellites to provide high-speed internet in remote areas using Elon Musk's Starlink system. UK government said it would start the trial using Starlink "given the readiness and availability of its technology". "These trials aim to find a solution to...high cost of rolling out cables to far-flung locations," the government added.

18.title: AAP to regularise markets not given licenses by MCD: Sisodia
18.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that AAP will regularise markets not granted licenses by MCD if they are voted to power after the MCD polls. Alleging that the BJP denied these markets licenses to "extort money", Sisodia said, "Bribe was rampant in issuing various kinds of licenses that was called 'BJP fees'." MCD polls will be on December 4.

19.title: HSBC cutting at least 200 senior operations managers worldwide: Report
19.article_body: HSBC is cutting at least 200 senior operations managers worldwide as it attempts to streamline its management ranks and reduce costs, Reuters reported. The cuts will fall across several business units and largely affect employees with the title of Chief Operating Officer. CEO Noel Quinn said HSBC has identified $1.7 billion of extra cost cuts it will make next year.

20.title: Twitter account of Ministry of Jal Shakti briefly hacked, probe launched
20.article_body: The Twitter handle of the Ministry of Jal Shakti was briefly hacked on early Thursday and reportedly 80 tweets were made. A tweet promoting crypto wallet Sui Wallet was first posted by the ministry's account at 5:38 am. The account's profile picture was also changed from the Indian flag to Sui's logo. A probe has been initiated by government officials.

21.title: Pragya Thakur withdraws discharge plea in court in Malegaon blast case
21.article_body: BJP MP Pragya Singh Thakur has withdrawn her discharge plea pending before Bombay HC in the 2008 Malegaon blast case. Sameer Kulkarni, a co-accused in the case, has also withdrawn his discharge plea in the matter. The accused withdrew their respective pleas after the court questioned the pleas' validity as over 200 witnesses had already been examined in the case.

22.title: Adani Group to invest ₹60,000 crore in Odisha over next 10 years
22.article_body: Adani Group will invest ₹60,000 crore over the next 10 years in Odisha, Karan Adani, CEO of Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone, said. The group will commission a liquefied natural gas terminal with a capacity of 5 million tonnes in Dhamra Port this month, he added. Adani mentioned that the group plans to double the capacity within five years.

23.title: Tata Steel will continue to invest in Odisha: CEO TV Narendran
23.article_body: Tata Steel CEO TV Narendran on Thursday said the company will continue to invest in Odisha. "The Tata group of companies, and more specifically Tata Steel, has invested over ₹75,000 crore in Odisha in the last five years," he said. Tata Steel is the largest steel manufacturer in Odisha producing about 9 million tonnes of steel annually, Narendran added.

24.title: Chance of global growth falling below 2% in 2023 rising, says IMF chief
24.article_body: International Monetary Fund (IMF) Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva said the chance of global growth falling below 2% in 2023 was increasing due to continued effects of Ukraine war and simultaneous slowdowns in Europe, China and US. Calling China a strong engine of global growth, Georgieva added that she's particularly concerned about the slowdown there.

25.title: 15-year-old Muslim girl free to marry person of her choice: Jharkhand High Court
25.article_body: Jharkhand High Court, referring to Muslim Personal Law, said Muslim girls aged 15 or above have liberty to marry the person of their choice without interference of their guardians. The court said this while quashing criminal proceedings against a Muslim youth who married a 15-year-old girl. He had challenged criminal proceedings based on an FIR filed by the girl's father.

26.title: 2nd-ranked Belgium crash out of 2022 FIFA World Cup
26.article_body: Belgium, who are the second-ranked team in the world, crashed out of 2022 FIFA World Cup in the group stage after playing out a 0-0 draw against Croatia in their last Group F match on Thursday. Belgium finished third in the group with four points. Notably, Belgium had finished third in the 2018 edition of the tournament.

27.title: Many areas of northwest India may have warmer winter this year: IMD
27.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Thursday said many areas of northwest India may have a warmer winter season this year due to expected reduced western disturbance activity and easterly wind penetration. "There will be less cloudiness and higher day temperatures. There could be penetration of easterly winds from the Bay of Bengal," said Dr Mrutyunjay Mohapatra, head of IMD.

28.title: Apple adds 4 iMacs, 1 Watch to list of obsolete & vintage products
28.article_body: Apple has added its 2013 and 2014 iMacs and Apple Watch Series 2 to its list of obsolete and vintage products, respectively. According to a report by MacRumors, Apple has added the 21.5-inch and 27-inch iMac (late 2013), 21.5-inch iMac (mid-2014) and the 27-inch Retina 5K iMac (late 2014) models to the obsolete list of products.

29.title: Hid Republican donations so media wouldn't freak the f**k out: FTX ex-CEO
29.article_body: Bankrupt crypto exchange FTX's Founder and ex-CEO Sam Bankman-Fried, who's thought to be a big Democratic Party donor, has revealed he donated equally to the Republican Party in 2022, but used "dark" money. "It's because reporters freak the f**k out if you donate to Republicans," the 30-year-old said, adding, "They're all secretly liberal...I didn't want to have that fight."

30.title: China has no say or veto: India on objection to Indo-US military drills
30.article_body: After China opposed the joint Indo-US military exercises being held near the LAC, India responded and said that China has "no veto" in the matter. "China or any other nation has no say or...veto on India's military exercise," the MEA said. China had claimed the military exercise violated the spirit of the two border agreements signed between Beijing and India.

31.title: Vande Bharat Express runs over cattle in Gujarat, 4th such incident in 2 months
31.article_body: Mumbai-bound Vande Bharat Express hit cattle between Valsad and Vapi stations in Gujarat on Thursday evening. In the fourth such incident since September 30, the train suffered a minor dent in the front portion with no operational issue and was halted for about 12 minutes. "The dent will be attended tonight," the Indian Railways said.

32.title: Never made remakes, never been inspired by foreign films: Bhandarkar
32.article_body: Filmmaker Madhur Bhandarkar said Bollywood should make more original content. "All these years, I have never done it. I've not even been inspired by foreign films, only by real stories and people," he added. According to Bhandarkar, content written by good writers will work. "It's time we introspect as there haven't been too many good movies this year," he stated.

33.title: Nearly 300 predatory loan apps found on Google, Apple stores: Report
33.article_body: Around 300 loan apps are circulating on Google Play and Apple App Store that exhibit predatory behaviour, according to a report by cloud security company Lookout. The apps exfiltrate excessive user data from mobile devices and harass borrowers for repayment. Lookout researchers discovered 251 Android apps with over 15 million collective downloads and 35 apps on the App Store.

34.title: Harbhajan Singh participates in AAP roadshow in Gujarat with Kejriwal
34.article_body: Cricketer-turned-politician Harbhajan Singh on Thursday participated in Aam Aadmi Party's roadshow in Ahmedabad ahead of the second phase of Gujarat Assembly elections. The Rajya Sabha MP addressed the public from an open vehicle along with Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann. Singh said he expects the same love in Gujarat which he received as a cricketer.

35.title: 991 players register for upcoming IPL auction to fill up 87 available spots
35.article_body: As many as 991 cricketers, including 277 overseas players, have signed up for the upcoming IPL auction to fill up the 87 available spots. The players' list incorporates 185 capped, 786 uncapped and 20 Associate players. The auction will take place on December 23 in Kochi. Out of the uncapped Indian players, 91 were a part of previous IPL seasons.

36.title: Essar Group to invest ₹52,000 cr on multiple projects in Odisha
36.article_body: Essar Group announced that it plans to invest ₹40,000 crore in a crude to petrochemical complex in Odisha. The complex, with an annual capacity of 7.5 million tonnes, will be built in partnership with an international firm. Essar also announced that it plans to set up an export-oriented pelletizing complex in Odisha at an investment of ₹12,000 crore.

37.title: I didn't know of improper use of customer funds: FTX ex-CEO
37.article_body: Bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange FTX's former CEO Sam Bankman-Fried denied knowing "that there was any improper use of customer funds". Bankman-Fried told ABC News that FTX had a borrowing-lending facility but he didn't know of deposits being used to pay its affiliated trading firm Alameda Research. "I failed to have someone in place who was managing that risk," he added.

38.title: Google appeals against EU's $4.3 bn Android antitrust fine
38.article_body: Google appealed a $4.3 billion antitrust fine imposed in 2018 by the European Union over the Android operating system restricting mobile competition and consumer choice. Google said it appealed the fine for "legal clarification from the European Court of Justice", the EU's top court. Notably, this is the largest-ever antitrust fine imposed by the European Commission, EU's competition watchdog.

39.title: Income Tax Dept attaches Andhra Pradesh minister's 'benami property'
39.article_body: A 30.83-acre piece of land belonging to Andhra Pradesh Labour Minister Gummanur Jayaram in Kurnool district has been attached by the Income Tax Department after it was alleged to be a 'benami' property. The I-T officials have attached the property for 90 days after invoking Section 24 (3) of the Prohibition of Benami Property Transactions Act, 1988.

40.title: Salon owner held for practising untouchability in TN's Thanjavur
40.article_body: Police in Tamil Nadu's Thanjavur district on Wednesday arrested a barber shop owner, 40-year-old Veeramuthu, after complaints of untouchability practice were raised. He allegedly refused to provide haircuts to people belonging to Scheduled Caste in Kilamangalam village. Members of the Scheduled Caste community claimed in the complaint that tea shops in the village still use a two-glass system.

41.title: Which states in India have the highest unemployment rate and which have the lowest?
41.article_body: Haryana had the highest unemployment rate of 30.6% among Indian states in the month of November, as per latest data from CMIE. It was followed by Rajasthan (24.5%), Jammu & Kashmir (23.9%), Bihar (17.3%), and Tripura (14.5%). Meanwhile, the states that had the lowest unemployment rates were Chhattisgarh (0.1%), Uttarakhand (1.2%), Odisha (1.6%), Karnataka (1.8%), and Meghalaya (2.1%).

42.title: Fake Gucci, Prada goods worth $10 mn from India & China caught in US
42.article_body: The New York Police seized three trucks carrying counterfeit products of luxury brands, worth over $10 million, from China and India. In the raid, fake bags, shoes, backpacks, watches and sunglasses of brands such as Louis Vuitton, Burberry, Gucci, Balenciaga, Prada, Dior, Rolex, and Yves Saint Laurent were recovered. They arrested 17 people in connection with the case.

43.title: TikTok's 'blackout challenge' linked to deaths of 20 children in 18 months: Report
43.article_body: The 'blackout challenge' on TikTok is linked to the deaths of at least 20 children in the past 18 months and at least 15 of those children were aged 12 or younger, Bloomberg reported. The challenge encourages people to choke themselves with household items until they become unconscious. They film the adrenaline rush once they regain consciousness.

44.title: Naseeruddin Shah called Kashmir Files false narrative: Piyush Mishra
44.article_body: Actor Piyush Mishra said that he remembers actor Naseeruddin Shah and journalist Ravish Kumar had called Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files' a "false narrative and a propaganda film". "I will show you the documentaries which have been made and based on the lives of Kashmiri Pandits. Every dialogue and incident matches what they have said [in the film]," he added.

45.title: YS Sharmila meets Telangana Governor over alleged attack by BRS workers
45.article_body: YSRTP chief YS Sharmila submitted a memorandum to Telangana Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan on Thursday over an alleged attack during her march by Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) workers in Warangal earlier this week. "We will be relieved if you can seek a report from the Home Ministry...on the recent attack," Sharmila said, expressing fear of more attacks in the future.

46.title: Inmates were pressurised to give 'special services' to Satyendar Jain: Inquiry panel
46.article_body: At least five Tihar jail inmates were pressurised by jail administration to provide "special services" to jailed Delhi minister Satyendar Jain, according to a report by an inquiry panel constituted by Delhi LG VK Saxena. The inmates feared that if they refused to obey administration's orders, they'd be tortured. The report said several jail officials were involved in serving Jain.

47.title: Over 25,000 people living with HIV in Assam: AIDS Control Society
47.article_body: More than 25,000 people are living with HIV in Assam, said the Assam State AIDS Control Society on Thursday, on the occasion of World AIDS Day. Of these persons, 45% are females. While the national HIV prevalence rate is 0.21%, it is 0.09% in Assam. Nearly 11,000 people are taking antiretroviral therapy in the state.

48.title: Rohit Shetty & Ajay Devgn to reunite for 'Singham Again'
48.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty and actor Ajay Devgn will reunite for the third instalment of the 'Singham' franchise, as per trade analyst Taran Adarsh's tweet. The trade analyst also confirmed that the film will be named 'Singham Again'. He further tweeted, "[Shooting] will start once Ajay is free from 'Bholaa'." 'Singham Returns' had released in 2014.

49.title: Serum Institute is India's most valuable unlisted company: Hurun
49.article_body: Adar Poonawalla-led Serum Institute of India (SII) is the most valuable unlisted company in India, as per Axis Bank and Hurun India's '2022 Burgundy Private Hurun India 500'. The pharmaceutical company's market valuation stood at ₹2.1 lakh crore, up 20% from last year. It is followed by  BYJU'S (valued at ₹1.8 lakh crore) and NSE (valued at  ₹1.3 lakh crore).

50.title: Guj's Vansda BJP candidate Piyush Bhai Patel alleges attack, probe on
50.article_body: BJP candidate of Vansda in Gujarat's Navsari district, Piyush Bhai Patel, alleged that he was attacked by unknown persons in Jhari village on Thursday morning. "Four to five vehicles were also damaged in the incident," Navsari SP said. Patel alleged that a group of around 25 youths who are supposed to be close to his rival Congress candidate attacked him.

51.title: Will stand & fight again: Bilkis on challenging early release of rapists
51.article_body: Bilkis Bano, who has moved Supreme Court challenging the early release of 11 convicts in the 2002 case related to her gangrape, has said she "will stand and fight" against wrongdoing. "I do this today for myself...and for women everywhere," she said. The convicts, who were sentenced to life imprisonment, were released on August 15 on account of "good behaviour".

52.title: Was paralysed with shock & fear: Bilkis Bano on release of rapists
52.article_body: Bilkis Bano on Thursday said that the release of 11 men, who raped her and killed her family members in the 2002 Gujarat riots, left her numb. "I was paralysed with shock and with fear for my children, my daughters and above all, paralysed by the loss of hope," she said. The convicts were released on grounds of "good behaviour".

53.title: Video shows IndiGo baggage handlers tossing boxes, airline says 'not customers' luggage'
53.article_body: IndiGo has offered an explanation after airline employees were seen tossing boxes onto a trailer. A Twitter user had shared a video of the incident. "The boxes...are not customers' luggage...these are fast-moving, light weight containers carrying non-fragile cargo...We'd like to assure you that our customers' possessions are our priority...they are handled with utmost care," the airline responded.

54.title: Pakistan Football Federation trolled for 'Our lion representing us at FIFA WC' tweet
54.article_body: The Pakistan Football Federation (PFF) has been trolled for their 'Our lion representing us at 2022 FIFA World Cup' tweet featuring Pakistan footballer Abdullah Shah. Reacting to the PFF mentioning "Not long before our National Team qualifies as well" in the tweet, a Pakistani user wrote, "Try and win a pre-qualifier first." Another wrote, "Make a league first."

55.title: Guj govt should give allowance to those who grow moustaches: Poll candidate
55.article_body: Gujarat Assembly poll candidate Maganbhai Solanki said the state government should pay some amount as "maintenance" to all people who grow moustaches. Solanki, who is contesting from Himatnagar seat in Sabarkantha district as an independent, has a moustache which is almost five-feet-long. He said he will urge the government to introduce a law encouraging youths to grow moustaches if elected.

56.title: Not aware of Waqf board plan on educational institutes for girls: K'taka CM
56.article_body: After reports stated that Karnataka's Waqf board will start self-funded schools and colleges for girls, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday said he wasn't aware of any such proposal. "I don't know, it might be his (Waqf Chairman) personal view," Bommai said. "It has not been discussed in any quarters of our government and it's not...my government's stand," Bommai added.

57.title: Voting ends in 1st phase of Guj Assembly polls, 60% voter turnout recorded
57.article_body: Voting for the first phase of the Gujarat Assembly polls for 89 seats across 19 districts of Saurashtra-Kutch and southern regions has ended. A total voter turnout of 60.20% was recorded until 5 pm. The Tapi district recorded the highest voter turnout at 72.32%, followed by the Narmada district at 68.09% and Dang district at 64.84%.

58.title: They did this despite being ill: Akhtar on England scoring 506 runs in a day vs Pak
58.article_body: After England broke world record for scoring most runs on Day 1 of a Test against Pakistan, Shoaib Akhtar said, "They did this despite being ill...imagine what would've happened if they were well." Akhtar's statement came after at least 14 members of England's touring party got ill ahead of the Test. England scored 506/4 on Day 1 of first Test.

59.title: Baba Ramdev selling fake ghee under Patanjali brand: BJP MP
59.article_body: BJP MP Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh has accused Baba Ramdev of selling fake ghee under the brand name of Patanjali. Singh, who represents Uttar Pradesh's Kaiserganj constituency, also advised people to keep a cow or buffalo in their homes instead of purchasing ghee from the market. "To stay healthy, it's very important to have...pure milk and ghee in...homes," he added.

60.title: PM Modi's policies creating social hostility which will break country: Cong
60.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Thursday claimed that PM Narendra Modi's policies were creating economic disparity, social hostility and political dictatorship, which would break the country. "The 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' being taken out by Rahul Gandhi will ensure that it will not happen," Ramesh said. Speaking to reporters in Ujjain, Ramesh said the yatra will reach Delhi on December 24.

61.title: Pic shows polar ice cap on Mars as the planet comes the closest to Earth
61.article_body: Astrophotographer Andrew McCarthy has captured a picture of Mars using a 14" telescope that shows the northern polar ice cap on the red planet. He took the picture at a time when Mars made its closest approach to Earth. Several people reacted to his photo, with one tweeting, "This is the best Earth-based image of Mars I've ever seen."

62.title: I still love India: Korean YouTuber who was harassed by 2 men on Mumbai road
62.article_body: The South Korean YouTuber who was harassed by two men on a Mumbai road during a live stream said, "While this incident tainted my memory, I still love India and will return back." One of the men had put his hand around the YouTuber's shoulder and tried to kiss her. Both the accused, Mobeen Chand and Mohammad Naqeeb, were arrested.

63.title: Spain boosts security as PM, other high-profile targets get letter bombs
63.article_body: Spain has tightened security after five letter bombs, containing explosive devices, were sent to high-profile targets, including the PM, Ukrainian ambassador in Madrid and US embassy. An official said early indications suggest that these letter bombs packages were sent from within the country. Notably, an employee at the Ukrainian embassy in Madrid got injured after he opened the letter bomb.

64.title: Mika Singh's farmhouse sealed in Gurugram
64.article_body: The Department of Town and Country Planning (DTCP) on Tuesday sealed three farmhouses, including one belonging to popular Punjabi singer Mika Singh, in the reservoir area near Damdama Lake in Sohna, Gurugram. It has been sealed because of green laws violation, said District Town Planner (enforcement) Amit Madholia. Notices had been served to the owners of these unauthorised structures.

65.title: Lata Mangeshkar gifted me gold chain on my birthday: Udit Narayan
65.article_body: Singer Udit Narayan recalled that late singer Lata Mangeshkar had gifted him a gold chain on his birthday. "On the sets of a singing show, when Lata ji got to know that it was my birthday, she immediately gifted me a gold chain," he added. Udit stated that it was the most memorable birthday gift he has received.

66.title: 'Kantara' has been blessing for us, we take pride in it: Producer
66.article_body: Producer Vijay Kiragandur said 'Kantara' has been a blessing for them. "We take pride in it as we could share our culture with the rest of the world. We like to reach the masses and want to convey our story to every nook and corner of India," he added. Vijay stated that 'Kantara' rose to fame due to "word-of-mouth publicity".

67.title: We're ready to listen if anyone wants to hold talks on Ukraine: Russia
67.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on Thursday said that the country is ready to listen if anyone wanted to hold talks on Ukraine. The minister further termed the Ukrainian allegations that Russia wanted talks in order to win time to regroup and rebuild its armed forces as absurd. Notably, Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

68.title: Charu Asopa used our daughter to gain views on YouTube: Rajeev Sen
68.article_body: In a new video released on his YouTube channel, Rajeev Sen said that his estranged wife Charu Asopa used their daughter Ziana to gain views on the platform. "Why don't you make vlogs without her? Show her face once in a blue moon...Obviously [the views] won't increase," he added. Rajeev stated Charu is playing the "victim card and woman card".

69.title: They're throwing 'kichad' at me, but I'm 'kattar imaandar': Kejriwal
69.article_body: Ahead of MCD polls, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal accused the Opposition of throwing 'kichad' (mud) at him, but claimed that he is 'kattar imaandar'. He added that the Opposition claimed Manish Sisodia was involved in a ₹10,000 crore scam, but the unaccounted money could never be found. Furthermore, even the chargesheet doesn't mention his name, Kejriwal said.

70.title: 104-year-old man, 100-year-old woman vote in Gujarat, ECI shares pics
70.article_body: Instead of opting for postal ballot, a 104-year-old man named Ramji Bhai arrived at a polling station to vote in Gujarat on Thursday. Kamuben Patel, a 100-year-old woman, also arrived at a polling station in Umbergaon to vote. The Election Commission of India shared pictures of the senior citizens. It tweeted, "[Ramji Bhai's]...enthusiasm to vote is an inspiration for everyone!"

71.title: TCS has India's largest female workforce at 2.1 lakh: Report
71.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is the biggest employer of women in the country, with about 2,10,000 female employees, according to a survey conducted by Burgundy Private and Hurun India. Women accounted for about 35% of TCS's 5,92,195 employees in 2022. Meanwhile, Infosys, Wipro, HCL Technologies, and Reliance Industries followed TCS in the top 5 for the highest female workforce.

72.title: Date sheets for ICSE Class 10, ISC Class 12 board exams announced
72.article_body: The Council For The Indian School Certificate Examinations (CISCE) on Thursday released the date sheets for the ICSE Class 10 and ISC Class 12 board examinations for 2023. The Class 10 exams will begin on February 27 and end on March 29. The Class 12 exams will begin on February 13 and end on March 31.

73.title: Ranveer Singh could play me in biopic, he's a chameleon: Karan Johar
73.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, during an interview, was asked to name an actor who could portray his role in his biopic if it's ever made. To this, Karan replied, "I think Ranveer Singh. He's like a chameleon and he will do his best." The 'Bajirao Mastani' actor is set to feature in Karan's upcoming directorial 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'.

74.title: Satyendar Jain broke jail rules, misused his position: Inquiry committee
74.article_body: The inquiry committee formed to look into allegations of preferential treatment provided to jailed Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain has found that the latter misused his position and violated prison norms. The findings come after CCTV footage showed Jain getting a massage and eating dry fruits in his Tihar Jail cell. Jain was jailed in connection with a money laundering case.

75.title: Railways earn ₹1.05 lakh cr from freight loading till November
75.article_body: Railways' freight loading for first eight months of current fiscal crossed last year's loading and earnings for the same period, the Ministry of Railways said on Thursday. Freight earnings in November saw a 16% year-on-year increase to ₹1.05 lakh crore against ₹91,127 crore from year-ago period. On a cumulative basis during April-November, freight loading of 978.72 MT was achieved.

76.title: Fish in glove, glass eels among people's choice finalists of wildlife photography
76.article_body: A picture of young perch fish trapped in the thumb of a surgical glove discarded in a canal in The Netherlands is among the 25 images shortlisted for the People's Choice Award of the Wildlife Photographer of the Year 2022 competition. Other finalists include a picture of glass eels, a portrait of a lion and golden snub-nosed monkeys.

77.title: Reliance Industries tops Hurun's list of 500 most valuable Indian companies
77.article_body: Mukesh Ambani-owned Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) has topped the list of 500 most valuable companies in India, according to Axis Bank and Hurun India's '2022 Burgundy Private Hurun India 500'. RIL's market valuation stood at ₹17.3 lakh crore, up 3.6% as compared to last year. Tata Consultancy Services with ₹11.7 lakh crore became second most valuable company.

78.title: Video shows TN fishermen releasing 2 rare dolphins stuck in fishing net
78.article_body: Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officer Supriya Sahu shared a video of fishermen in Tamil Nadu releasing two rare species of dolphins into the sea after they were trapped in their nets while fishing. In the video, the fishermen can be seen untangling one of the dolphins from the net and taking it back to the sea.

79.title: M-cap of BSE-listed firms touches all-time high of ₹289.88 lakh crore
79.article_body: The market capitalisation (m-cap) of firms listed on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) reached an all-time high of ₹289.88 lakh crore on December 1. Closing higher for the eighth consecutive session, Sensex settled at its all-time high of 63,284.19 on Thursday. In the past eight sessions, m-cap of BSE-listed firms has risen by ₹8.96 lakh crore.

80.title: Going to be very interesting: Zuckerberg on Musk's Twitter approach
80.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg said it's "going to be very interesting" to see how Elon Musk's approach to Twitter plays out. "Not everything is going to work...but I think some things might work," Zuckerberg said. He suggested that Musk's content moderation decisions might face challenges. "People [should] have a vehicle that they can appeal to outside of us," he stated.

81.title: PM Modi stops convoy to give way to ambulance during Guj roadshow
81.article_body: In a video shared by ANI, PM Narendra Modi can be seen stopping his convoy to give way to an ambulance during his roadshow in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. The 'Pushpanjali Yatra' is the BJP's longest roadshow ever, according to the party. It started at Naroda Gam in Ahmedabad and will end at the Gandhinagar South constituency.

82.title: Pak hands over BSF jawan who accidentally crossed border due to fog
82.article_body: A Border Security Force (BSF) jawan, who inadvertently crossed over to Pakistan on Thursday has been handed over to the Indian authorities, an official said. The jawan crossed over while undertaking a zero line checking along the border in the morning amid extreme "poor visibility" due to dense fog. Pakistan Rangers handed over the jawan during a flag meeting.

83.title: Girl, her family beaten up for resisting molestation attempt in UP; video surfaces
83.article_body: A girl and her family were beaten up by miscreants in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut for resisting a molestation attempt, a video of which has surfaced online. The miscreants also attacked the neighbours who tried to save them. A case was registered at TP Nagar police station. Police have launched an investigation into the matter.

84.title: Meta removes 3.2 crore Facebook, Instagram posts in India in Oct
84.article_body: Meta took down over 2.92 crore pieces of bad content across 13 policies for Facebook and over 27 lakh pieces of such content across 12 policies for Instagram in India in October, the company said. During this period, Meta received 703 reports on Facebook and 1,377 reports on Instagram through its Indian grievance mechanism and responded to 100% of them.

85.title: Thane civic body waives penalty on overdue water bill
85.article_body: The Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC) has waived the penalty on overdue water bills under Abhay Yojana. Accordingly, from 1 December 2022 to 31 March 2023, the entire amount of the water tax penalty will be waived. The civic body has appealed to the citizens to pay the overdue water bill promptly and claim the penalty waiver to avoid severe action.

86.title: Scolded for wearing leggings, Kerala teacher files complaint against principal
86.article_body: A teacher who was scolded for wearing leggings to government school has filed a complaint against the headmistress. Speaking about a student who did not wear the school uniform, the headmistress told the complainant that if teachers come wrongly dressed, how can they be models to students. Hurt by her comments, the teacher filed a complaint with education department officials.

87.title: Don't broadcast content glorifying alcohol: Centre to radio channels
87.article_body: The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting has cautioned FM radio channels against broadcasting songs and other content that glorify use of drugs, alcohol and weapons. The ministry said the terms and conditions mentioned in the Grant Of Permission Agreement and Migration Grant Of Permission Agreement must be adhered to. "Any violation shall entail such penal action," the ministry said.

88.title: 'Tukde Tukde' gang part of the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra': MP Minister
88.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra criticised Rahul Gandhi-led 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and called it a yatra of 'Tukde Tukde' gang supporters. "Kanhaiya Kumar is a part of the yatra...The girl who said the 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogan also participated in the yatra," Mishra said. "Rahul ji, is this yatra supporting the people trying to divide India?" Mishra questioned.

89.title: Charminar to be illuminated with G20 logo to mark India's Presidency
89.article_body: The Charminar in Hyderabad will be illuminated with the G20 logo for seven days to celebrate India's Presidency. India assumed the Presidency from today for one year. The logo will illuminate 100 monuments, including UNESCO world heritage sites, and will be used as per guidelines issued by the Ministry of External Affairs as per an Archaeological Survey of India memorandum.

90.title: Was nervous to direct Ajay Devgn in 'Drishyam 2': Abhishek Pathak
90.article_body: Filmmaker Abhishek Pathak, who recently directed 'Drishyam 2', said that he has known actor Ajay Devgn since his childhood. "I never thought I'd get to direct him in my first or second film. I was nervous about the fact that I always looked at him in a certain way but now I have to direct him," he further added.

91.title: Govt cuts windfall tax on domestic crude oil output, diesel exports
91.article_body: Indian government on Thursday stated that it has further cut windfall tax on exports of locally produced oil and diesel. The windfall tax on locally produced crude oil has been cut to ₹4,900 per tonne. The export tax on diesel was reduced to ₹6.5 per litre. Changes to the windfall tax will be effective from Friday, the order said.

92.title: Indian-American influencer calls Varanasi 'scariest city' she ever visited, apologises
92.article_body: Indian-American influencer Aparna Singh has apologised for her video on Varanasi, wherein she called it the "scariest city" she ever visited. The video begins with Singh pointing out how polluted the Ganges river is, and then she calls her hotel "old and creepy". After people criticised her, she said, "I wasn't trying to be disrespectful. I was...just [stating] my experience."

93.title: JNU campus defaced with anti-Brahmin slogans, pics surface
93.article_body: Several buildings on Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) campus in Delhi were defaced on Thursday with anti-Brahmin slogans. Pictures of the same have surfaced online. RSS-affiliated Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) accused the left of the vandalisation. "Highly deplorable act of vandalism!" wrote JNU Teachers' Forum on Twitter.

94.title: Dying for the last 7 days, says Ex-MP CM on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
94.article_body: A video of former MP CM Kamal Nath talking about the gruelling schedule of Rahul Gandhi-led 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' has now gone viral. In the video, the Congress leader can be heard complaining about Gandhi's insistence on walking at least 24 kilometres every day. We've been dying for the last seven days, Nath can be heard saying.

95.title: People face heavy traffic jam at Mumbai's Birsa Munda Chowk
95.article_body: People witnessed heavy traffic jam at Birsa Munda Chowk in Mumbai's Goregaon area on Thursday morning. Pictures from the scene showed a pile up of cars, bikes and auto-rickshaws. Mumbai Police officials reached the spot to clear the congestion. As per an official, the traffic jam was due to road development work by the civic body at Aarey Milk Colony.

96.title: Want him home: Family of Indian student killed in Canada awaits his body
96.article_body: Family members of 20-year-old Kartik Saini, the Indian student who was killed after being hit and dragged by a pickup truck while crossing a road on a bicycle in Canada's Toronto last month, are still awaiting his body. "We want him to come home. We want his remains so we can carry out all the rituals," Saini's family members said.

97.title: She is good as a sister-in-law: Jadeja's sister on campaigning against BJP's Rivaba
97.article_body: Cricketer Ravindra Jadeja's sister Naina, who campaigned against her sister-in-law and BJP's Rivaba Jadeja, said, "My love for my brother stays the same." She added, "My sister-in-law is a BJP candidate as of now. As a sister-in-law, she is good." Rivaba will be contesting the elections from Jamnagar (North) constituency. Naina campaigned for Congress amid Gujarat Assembly polls.

98.title: Indian healthcare sector suffers 1.9 mn cyberattacks in 2022: Report
98.article_body: The healthcare industry in India faced nearly 1.9 million cyberattacks this year till November 28, as per data published by cybersecurity think tank CyberPeace Foundation. The attacks came from a total of 41,181 unique IP addresses, traced back to countries including Vietnam, Pakistan and China. The report comes after AIIMS Delhi reported a massive cyberattack on its server last week.

99.title: Russia refuses to sell crude oil to Pakistan at discounted rate: Report
99.article_body: A Pakistani delegation held talks with their Russian counterparts and asked for a 30-40% discount on crude oil, a report said. However, Russia has refused to sell the oil to Pakistan at a discounted rate and said it couldn't offer anything right now as all volumes were committed, the report added. Reportedly, Russia became India's top oil supplier in October.

100.title: All systems down at Mumbai airport's Terminal 2, huge queues form at counters
100.article_body: All systems at Mumbai airport's Terminal 2 were down on Thursday, causing passengers to wait for nearly an hour for baggage drop at the airline counters, the Hindustan Times reported. A Vistara spokesperson said that all airlines were impacted. "The crowd is being managed well and there's no chaos as manual passes are being issued," ANI quoted CISF as saying.

101.title: Aamir Khan attends FIFA WC with ex-wife Kiran, son Azad; pics viral
101.article_body: Pictures of actor Aamir Khan attending the FIFA World Cup 2022 in Qatar with ex-wife Kiran Rao and son Azad Rao Khan have gone viral on social media. In the pictures posted by Aamir's fan accounts on social media, the actor can be seen posing with fans. Aamir had recently featured in the film 'Laal Singh Chaddha'.

102.title: Online marketplaces expected to reach $350 bn GMV by 2027: Report
102.article_body: India's online marketplaces are expected to record a gross merchandise value (GMV) of over $350 billion by 2027, according to a report by Bain & Company and Accel. The report added that online marketplaces in India have hit $100 billion in GMV, driven by growing online shopper base. Marketplaces are expected to contribute over 5% to India's GDP by 2027.

103.title: Despite launching 'Garibi Hatao' poverty increased under Cong: PM
103.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said despite Congress launching the 'Garibi Hatao' campaign, poverty increased under its regime. "The only thing they did was...raise slogans, give promises and misguide people. That was the reason why poverty actually increased during its regime," Modi alleged. He blamed Congress and its policies for the poor being unable to play an active role in the economy.

104.title: GST collection rises 11% YoY in Nov to over ₹1.45 lakh crore
104.article_body: The government collected more than ₹1.45 lakh crore as goods and services tax (GST) in November, a 11% year-on-year increase. The increase was driven by a 20% year-on-year rise in revenues from import of goods. GST collections are 3.9% lower from October's collection of ₹1.52 lakh crore. GST collections have exceeded ₹1.40 lakh crore for nine months in a row.

105.title: Fire breaks out in bamboo forest in Thane, no casualties reported
105.article_body: A fire broke out in a bamboo forest opposite Saket Police ground in Thane on Thursday at around 1:20 pm. Fire brigade personnel and a team of Regional Disaster Management Cell (RDMC) doused the fire by 2 pm. Officials said no casualties were reported due to the fire. RDMC chief Avinash Sawant said the situation is under control.

106.title: DMK MLA shares meme calling TN Guv 'most useless thing in democracy'
106.article_body: DMK MLA TRB Rajaa shared a meme on Twitter calling Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi "the most useless thing in democracy". "A political appointee trying to sabotage...functioning of an elected regime is a blot on democracy," Rajaa tweeted. He shared another meme quoting DMK Founder CN Annadurai, asking if a goat requires beard and whether a state needs a Governor.

107.title: Now every Indian can make the right investing moves: ET Money
107.article_body: With ET Money, investors in India will no longer need to waste hours tracking markets, economy, interest rates to make right investing decisions that grow money effortlessly, said the company. ET Money app tells investors when and where to invest to earn better returns so Indian investors can put their money to work rather than working for it, it added.

108.title: Moosewala's father asks Centre to announce ₹2 cr reward on Goldy Brar
108.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala's father has asked the Centre to announce a reward of ₹2 crore for information about gangster Goldy Brar that could lead to his arrest. The Canada-based gangster is reportedly the mastermind behind Moosewala's murder. Balkaur Singh also said that he can pay the reward from his pocket if the government is unable to give the amount.

109.title: Twitter bans 44,611 accounts in India promoting child porn in 1 month
109.article_body: Twitter banned 44,611 accounts in India for promoting child sexual exploitation and non-consensual nudity between September 26 and October 25. Twitter also took down 4,014 accounts for promoting terrorism in India. In its monthly report, the micro-blogging site said it processed 61 grievances which appealed for suspension of accounts and didn't overturn the suspension for any of them.

110.title: Server down at Mumbai airport, check-ins for all airlines impacted
110.article_body: A technical failure has been reported at the Mumbai airport, which has impacted check-ins for all airlines. The Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport said that the issue is being resolved and operations are expected to resume in a short while. According to a report by PTI, the privatisation of the Mumbai airport has been put on hold by the government.

111.title: Temasek picks up 1.1% stake in Zomato for ₹608 crore
111.article_body: Singapore-based investment firm Temasek picked up a 1.14% stake, or 9.8 crore shares, in Zomato for ₹607.6 crore through its subsidiary Camas Investments Pte. Post the transaction, Camas Investments Pte's stake in the company increased to 4%. Meanwhile, Alipay Singapore, an arm of Chinese e-commerce company Alibaba, offloaded a 3.07% stake in Zomato for ₹1,631 crore, exchange data showed.

112.title: Centre directs Raj, UP, Haryana to register only CNG, e-autos in NCR from Jan 1
112.article_body: Centre's Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) has directed Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh and Haryana governments to register only CNG and electric autos in the National Capital Region from January 1. CAQM has further directed the three governments to phase out diesel autos by 2026-end. NCR covers Delhi, 14 districts of Haryana, eight districts of UP and two districts of Rajasthan.

113.title: Rahul Gandhi's care toward everyone is astounding: Swara Bhasker
113.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker, who joined Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in Bharat Jodo Yatra in Madhya Pradesh on Thursday, tweeted, "Rahul Gandhi's attention and care toward everyone and everything around him is astounding." "You gotta be here to feel the energy and the love. Seriously, join the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' people. Resist hate. Stand up for our country," the actress tweeted.

114.title: Doctor asked me to pull the plug when my mother was in coma: Paresh
114.article_body: Paresh Rawal recalled the doctor had asked him to "pull the plug" while his mother was in a coma. "[Doctor] told me, 'Paresh, she's on life support...By waiting...you're prolonging her death'," Paresh said. He stated his mother passed away due to a heart attack. "She didn't put us in the position where we'd have to pull the plug," he added.

115.title: Author-director of Kannada play on Tipu Sultan alleges death threats
115.article_body: The author-director of the controversial Kannada play and book titled 'Tipu Nija Kanasugalu' (Real dreams of Tipu), Addanda C Cariappa, has lodged a complaint with police alleging that he received death threats. "I received two letters...The message is that I'll be killed and no God can save me," Cariappa said. The Kannada play has been going on since November 20.

116.title: Delhi HC declares ITC's Bukhara restaurant a 'well-known trademark'
116.article_body: The Delhi HC recently declared ITC Maurya's 'Bukhara' restaurant as a "well-known trademark". The court said the documents placed on record by ITC Limited show that "not only has the mark 'Bukhara' been intrinsically connected to Indian cuisine" but the restaurant has also been recognised internationally as a customary stop for foreign celebrities and dignitaries.

117.title: Slow voting took place in Guj's Katargam due to BJP pressure: AAP's Italia
117.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party leader Gopal Italia on Thursday claimed that voting was deliberately slowed down in the Katargam Assembly Constituency due to pressure from the BJP. "If you have to work only under the pressure of BJP goons, then why do you get elections done?" he said referring to the Election Commission. Italia is contesting from the Katargam seat.

118.title: Gold ornaments worth ₹15 lakh stolen from doctor's house in Chandigarh
118.article_body: Gold ornaments weighing 20-25 tola, worth around ₹15 lakh, were stolen from the house of a neurosurgeon, Dr Puneet Singhal, in Chandigarh's Sector 15 on Sunday. "The spot inspection suggests that thieves left out some ornaments and stole only a few," police said. Police added that doctor's family members were present at the house when the theft took place.

119.title: SUV rotates several times after meeting with an accident in Jodhpur
119.article_body: An SUV rotated several times as it skidded on the road after an accident in Rajasthan's Jodhpur, a video of which has gone viral on social media. According to reports, the SUV lost control and crashed into a divider after it was hit by another vehicle from behind. Some reports also said that the tyres of the SUV burst.

120.title: DigiYatra for paperless entry introduced at 3 airports today
120.article_body: Union Minister of Civil Aviation Jyotiraditya Scindia on Thursday inaugurated 'DigiYatra' for paperless entry at airports. "In the first phase, DigiYatra will be launched at seven airports," said Scindia. "It is initially being launched at three airports on December 1 - Delhi, Varanasi and Bengaluru. It will be introduced in Kolkata, Pune, Hyderabad and Vijayawada by March 2023," he added.

121.title: Boy detained for allegedly raping, killing 9-yr-old girl near Mumbai
121.article_body: A 15-year-old boy has been detained over allegations of rape and murder of a nine-year-old girl in Kalyan near Mumbai. "We've detained [the] boy over suspicious ground and therefore we enquired with him," police said. The girl was found lying injured on Thursday at Kalyan railway station. She was taken to a hospital but doctors declared her dead on arrival.

122.title: Scared journalist produces a dead citizen: Ravish Kumar after leaving NDTV
122.article_body: Journalist Ravish Kumar, who left NDTV after more than 26 years, in a YouTube video said, "A scared journalist produces a dead citizen, which is why it's important to say, 'We aren't scared'." He added, "You're the citizens of the country that took down the British Raj." Ravish resigned from NDTV days after Adani Group purchased a stake in it.

123.title: Erstwhile royal family of Rajkot arrives in vintage car to cast vote
123.article_body: Members of the erstwhile royal family of Rajkot, Mandhatasinh Jadeja, Kadambari Devi Jadeja and Mridulakumari Jadeja, cast their votes at a polling station during the first phase of Gujarat Assembly elections on Thursday. Visuals from the scene showed the family arriving at the booth in a vintage car. Mandhatasinh Jadeja said, "Ballot is more powerful than bullet."

124.title: Password manager LastPass hacked for the second time in 2022
124.article_body: LastPass has admitted that it was recently hacked, marking the second time the password manager was hacked in less than a year. "An unauthorised party, using information obtained in the August 2022 incident, was able to gain access to certain elements of our customers' information," LastPass said. "Our customers' passwords remain safely encrypted," it added.

125.title: Won't proceed with delimitation for BMC polls till Dec 20: Maha govt to HC
125.article_body: Maharashtra government has told Bombay HC that it won't proceed with delimitation process for BMC polls till the court hears a plea filed by ex-corporators on December 20. The ex-corporators have challenged state government's decision to reverse MVA government's move to go ahead with delimitation of BMC wards. MVA government had increased number of electoral wards from 227 to 236.

126.title: 43-yr-old Mumbai man assaulted while confronting men for harassing a woman
126.article_body: A 43-year-old man, Javed Ateeq Khan, was brutally assaulted on Tuesday in Mumbai's Goregaon while confronting men who were harassing a young woman. According to Khan, the incident took place when he saw his acquaintance's daughter crying. "I...went to confront the garage people and tell him to stop troubling the girl," Khan said, adding he was assaulted by three men.

127.title: Ravindra Jadeja casts his vote in Gujarat's Jamnagar, shares pic
127.article_body: Cricketer Ravindra Jadeja on Thursday cast his vote at Jamnagar for the Gujarat Assembly elections. Earlier on Wednesday, Jadeja shared an old clip of Shiv Sena supremo late Bal Thackeray on Twitter. In the clip, Bal Thackeray had said, "Modi gaya to Gujarat gaya." Notably, Jadeja's wife has been fielded by BJP to contest from the Jamnagar (North) constituency.

128.title: Delhi Police retrieve phone Aftab had sold after killing Shraddha
128.article_body: Delhi Police has retrieved Aftab Poonawala's old phone, which he had reportedly sold after killing his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar, in an effort to erase the evidence. Investigators are hopeful of retrieving data from the device, which can strengthen the case against Aftab, reports said. However, Shraddha Walkar's mobile phone is yet to be recovered.

129.title: England become first team in history to score 500 runs on Day 1 of a Test
129.article_body: England on Thursday became the first team in history to score at least 500 runs on Day 1 of a Test. England crossed the 500-run mark in the 75th over in their first innings on Day 1 of Rawalpindi Test against Pakistan. Australia held the previous record for scoring most runs on Day 1 of a Test (494/6).

130.title: Principal makes SC students clean toilets in Tamil Nadu, suspended and booked
130.article_body: The principal of a primary school in Tamil Nadu's Erode was suspended and booked under the SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act for allegedly forcing students from the Scheduled Caste community to clean toilets. The principal is on the run after the complaint was registered against her. The incident came to light after a student fell ill after cleaning the toilets.

131.title: Elon Musk is the bravest, most creative person: Netflix CEO Reed Hastings
131.article_body: Netflix CEO Reed Hastings has described Elon Musk as the "bravest and most creative" person on the planet. Hastings said this at The New York Times DealBook Summit, where he added that he is "100% confident" that Musk is "trying to help the world with his endeavours". Hastings mentioned that people should not be "nitpicky" with the new Twitter owner.

132.title: Google sued for $16.3 billion in UK over antitrust adtech practices
132.article_body: Google has been sued by a group of digital publishers in UK who allege the company and its parent Alphabet abused their dominant position in the online advertising market. The class action lawsuit, filed on behalf of 1,30,000 publishing-related businesses, claims that Google earned "super profits" while revenue for publishers decreased. The lawsuit seeks up to $16.3 billion in damages.

133.title: Mumbai Traffic Police announce restrictions on Dec 2 due to VIP movement
133.article_body: Mumbai Traffic Police has shared a one-day traffic advisory for December 2 due to VIP movement on account of the Indian Navys' Beating Retreat and Tattoo Ceremony. From 11:00 am-12:30 pm and 2:30 pm-5:00 pm, traffic movement would be slow around Santacruz, Vakola, Bandra, Worli sea link, Haji Ali, Air India and Regal Circle, the notice read.

134.title: What measures taken to safeguard Bengaluru's KR Puram lake?: NGT to officials
134.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has asked the Bangalore Water Supply and Sewerage Board and the Karnataka State Pollution Control Board to submit reports on the measures taken to stop entry of sewage water into the KR Puram lake. If the reports are not submitted by December 16, then summons will be sent to the respective officials, the tribunal said.

135.title: NRI forgets jewellery worth ₹1 crore in cab in Greater Noida, police find it in 4 hours
135.article_body: A Non-Resident Indian, who had come for his daughter's wedding, forgot a bag full of jewellery and valuables worth over ₹1 crore in a cab in Greater Noida. The bag along with its content was recovered within four hours after the cab was traced in Ghaziabad. The driver said he was unaware of the bag being in the cab's boot.

136.title: Pics show President Murmu handing out National Sports Awards 2022
136.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sharath Kamal was awarded the Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award by President Droupadi Murmu during the award ceremony for the National Sports Awards 2022. The Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award is the highest award for any Indian sportsperson. The Arjuna Award was bestowed to 25 athletes, including shuttler Lakshya Sen and boxer Nikhat Zareen.

137.title: BJP deployed 17 Union Ministers to fight 'aam aadmi' like me: Kejriwal
137.article_body: Ahead of the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) polls, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said that BJP has deployed 17 Union Ministers to fight an "aam aadmi" (common man) like him. If given a chance to run the MCD for five years, the AAP "will give you a sparkling clean Delhi", Kejriwal said. This election is about Delhi's prestige, he added.

138.title: AAP MLA says ‘gaon vaale set ho jaate hain’ during elections, BJP shares video
138.article_body: BJP leader Shehzad Poonawalla on Thursday shared a video of AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj, who can be heard saying, "Gaon vaale set ho jaate hain." In the video, Bharadwaj alleges that they're aware of the distribution of alcohol during elections, but the EC and the police aren't informed. No wonder his government did 'sharab ghotala' (liquor scam), Poonawalla said.

139.title: More time needed to conduct BBMP elections: Karnataka govt to HC
139.article_body: The Karnataka government has informed the High Court that it will require more time to hold the elections to the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). Appearing for the government, Additional Advocate General Dhyan Chinnappa said information regarding the reservation of Backward Classes was sought from the Justice Bhakthavatsala Committee. The committee has sought time to give the details.

140.title: US & NATO are direct participants in Ukraine war: Russia
140.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said that the US and NATO are direct participants in the Ukraine war because they're supplying arms to Kyiv and providing it with military training on their territory. He also defended Russian strikes on Ukrainian energy infrastructure, saying Russia disabled energy facilities to stop the West from sending "lethal weapons into Ukraine to kill Russians".

141.title: Ukraine's 'surrender hotline' for Russian troops gets 100 calls a day: Report
141.article_body: Ukraine has said that a scheme it created for Russian soldiers wanting to surrender is receiving about 100 enquiries a day, BBC reported. Under "I Want To Live" project, Russian soldiers can surrender either by calling a hotline or by submitting information through messaging apps. There had been over 3,500 contacts from occupying personnel and their families, Ukrainian officials said.

142.title: They followed me, wanted my phone number: Korean YouTuber on Mumbai men who harassed her
142.article_body: South Korean YouTuber Hyojeong Park said she was followed by the two men who harassed her during her live stream on a Mumbai street. She said the men, identified as Mobeen and Mohammad, tailed her as she walked to her hotel and asked for her phone number. Park added that she gave them a fake number so they would leave.

143.title: Samson left out despite being good enough: Doull on ODIs vs Bangladesh
143.article_body: Discussing India's squad for the upcoming ODI series against Bangladesh, ex-New Zealand pacer Simon Doull said, "Sanju Samson is good enough to play and they're leaving him out. Why're they taking Rajat Patidar?" "There are gaps for them to fill the wicketkeeper-batter's slot, one thing [which is]...a concern," added Doull. The first ODI will take place on December 4.

144.title: 6-month road safety drive on Pune-Mumbai highways begins
144.article_body: Maharashtra government has launched an awareness drive on two highways connecting Pune and Mumbai, the Expressway and the Old Highway. In the six-month-long drive, officials will survey accident-prone 'black spots' and take action against overspeeding and wrong parking, etc. The drive comes as CM Eknath Shinde directed officials to take action towards increasing the safety on these two highways.

145.title: Aftab Poonawala's 'confessions' have no legal validity, say experts
145.article_body: Aftab Poonawala's reported "confessions", including those allegedly made before a magistrate, have no legal validity, experts said, doubting that several key conditions were not fulfilled. On his confession through video conferencing, retired Delhi HC judge Justice Sodhi said, "This is an objectionable method of appearance. You do not know under what pressure he was in."

146.title: SRK & I had bit of an eye lock: Kartik on his first visit to Mannat
146.article_body: Kartik Aaryan recalled that when he had come to Mumbai for the first time, he visited Mannat on a Sunday when he saw Shah Rukh Khan getting out of his car. "We had a bit of an eye lock...I was so happy that he had looked at me," he shared. Earlier, Kartik called himself a "huge fan" of Shah Rukh.

147.title: I'm a big fan of Ayushmann Khurrana, says 'Fauda' actor Lior Raz
147.article_body: Israeli actor Lior Raz, who featured in the show 'Fauda', has said that he is a big fan of actor Ayushmann Khurrana at the 53rd International Film Festival of India (IFFI). Reacting to this, Ayushmann thanked Lior. Ayushmann was honoured at the film festival for being the "Biggest Disruptor" and "Game Changer" in Hindi cinema.

148.title: It was intended to be FTX's property: Sam on parents' Bahamas house
148.article_body: On reports of Sam Bankman-Fried's parents buying property in the Bahamas, the bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange FTX's Founder and ex-CEO said, he didn't know the details of the house for his parents. "I knew that it was not intended to be their long-term property...it was intended to be the company's property. I don't know how that was papered in," he said.

149.title: AAP used Delhi excise policy as device to generate illegal funds: ED
149.article_body: AAP leaders used the Delhi excise policy as a device to generate illegal funds, the Enforcement Directorate (ED) informed a local court on Wednesday. "The policy was formulated with deliberate loopholes, an in-built mechanism to facilitate illegal activities and is marred with deliberate inconsistencies which when looked deeply, reflect mala fide intentions of policy-makers," it alleged.

150.title: West Bengal declares state holiday on December 26
150.article_body: West Bengal government has declared December 26, the day after Christmas, a state holiday. As per the government notification, the holiday is for all state government offices, local bodies, statutory bodies, boards, corporations, and educational institutions under the state government. The offices of Registrar of Assurances and Collector of Stamp Revenue in Kolkata will, however, remain open.

151.title: 17-year-old boy dies in pool ahead of CBSE school swim meet near Bengaluru
151.article_body: Roshan Rashid, a 17-year-old Class 12 student from Kerala's Thrissur district, died in a swimming pool ahead of a CBSE south zone swimming competition near Bengaluru. His aunt alleged that Roshan was electrocuted after coming in touch with the lighting equipment around the pool. She has filed a complaint of death due to negligence against the organisers of the event.

152.title: BCCI appoints 3-member advisory committee to pick new selectors
152.article_body: The BCCI has announced the appointment of Ashok Malhotra, Jatin Paranjape and Sulakshana Naik in a three-member Cricket Advisory Committee (CAC). Malhotra and Paranjape have replaced Madan Lal and RP Singh in the committee. The committee's first task will be to pick a new selection committee for Team India.

153.title: Ruturaj watches Dhoni very closely, handles pressure like him: Hussey
153.article_body: CSK batting coach and former Australian batter Michael Hussey said CSK batter Ruturaj Gaikwad watches the team's captain MS Dhoni very closely. "He's...very calm when it comes to handling...pressure like Dhoni and he is a very good reader of the game...Ruturaj has got some excellent leadership qualities," added Hussey. "He's quite good at picking up new things," stated Hussey.

154.title: Tesla to recall 4,35,000 cars in China over side marker light issue
154.article_body: Tesla will recall more than 4,35,000 vehicles in China for a software update to fix an issue with side marker lights that could, in extreme cases, lead to a collision, a regulatory body said. This covers 1,42,277 Model 3 cars and 2,92,855 Model Y cars. Last week, Tesla recalled over 80,000 cars in China over software and seat belt issues.

155.title: Man reschedules his wedding to cast vote in Gujarat
155.article_body: A man rescheduled his wedding to cast his vote in Gujarat's Tapi during the state Assembly elections on Thursday. Prafulbhai More had to leave for Maharashtra on Thursday morning for his wedding but he rescheduled it for evening. He arrived at a polling booth wearing kurta-pyjama covered in turmeric. "I urge everyone to vote, you shouldn't waste it," Prafulbhai said.

156.title: Noida Police arrest 3 for selling fake iPhones; seize 60 mobiles
156.article_body: The Noida Police have arrested three men for allegedly cheating people by selling fake iPhones. The accused used to allegedly purchase duplicate phones from markets in Delhi and would sell them to people after placing the mobiles in original iPhone boxes, which they purchased from Chinese online shopping portal Alibaba. Police seized 60 duplicate iPhones and ₹4,50,000 cash from them.

157.title: England players got sick due to low immunity, not due to chef: Mohammad Hafeez
157.article_body: After several England players got sick in Rawalpindi ahead of the first Test against Pakistan, former Pakistan all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez stated that they got sick due to low immunity and not due to chef. Hafeez was reacting to a tweet that pointed out that England had brought their own chef to cook food for the team in Pakistan.

158.title: He tried to kiss me twice: Korean YouTuber who was harassed in Mumbai
158.article_body: A South Korean YouTuber who was harassed during a live stream by two men on a Mumbai road said that one of them tried to kiss her twice. "He put his hand on my shoulder and tried to kiss me...He then offered to give me a ride to my hotel...and tried to kiss me for the second time," she said.

159.title: Valuations don't matter if you don't survive: Accel's Anand Daniel to startups
159.article_body: Anand Daniel, Partner at Accel India, suggested startup founders to think about survival than valuations. "If you are not there on the other side, what is the point of holding on to a lot of stock," he told Moneycontrol. "If they didn't raise enough capital last year and have to raise money today, all these valuations don't matter," he added.

160.title: 2 transgender doctors join government service in Telangana for the first time
160.article_body: Prachi Rathod and Ruth John Paul have joined state-run Osmania General Hospital as medical officers and have become Telangana's first transgender doctors to join government service. "I really did not expect this because...[since 2018] I was rejected by at least 15 hospitals in Hyderabad," said Paul. "[The] discrimination would never go in spite of all your achievements," said Rathod.

161.title: I don't care: Vivek on Nadav's apology for 'Kashmir Files' remarks
161.article_body: Vivek Agnihotri said he doesn't care about Israeli filmmaker Nadav Lapid's apology for calling 'The Kashmir Files' a "vulgar" film. He added, "I don't care about what he says or doesn't...I'm getting so much love for the film...What does he know about my country?" Nadav recently apologised for his comments and said that he never wanted to "insult people...who've suffered".

162.title: There will be no layoffs, will hire & spend cautiously: Kovai.co Founder
162.article_body: Coimbatore-based Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) platform Kovai.co's Founder Saravana Kumar said the startup does not plan any layoffs but will spend and hire cautiously. "I have always believed in maintaining a spending and hiring discipline," Kumar said. "There is no hard stop in hiring...but we are also focusing on making our current workforce more productive," he added.

163.title: 4 interstate drug peddlers held in Hyderabad, 12 grams heroin seized
163.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested four interstate drug peddlers, seized 12 grams of heroin and four mobile phones from them. Acting on a tip-off, police arrested 26-year-old Syed Aamiar Moiz and 26-year-old Mohammed Saad of Bengaluru, 24-year-old Palem Nivas of Nellore and 20-year-old Ranganadha Chary of Vikarabad. The gang was supplying the drugs to local consumers, police said.

164.title: Jet fuel price slashed by 2.3% to ₹1.17 lakh per kilolitre in Delhi
164.article_body: Price of aviation turbine fuel (ATF), or jet fuel, was reduced by ₹2,775/kilolitre, or 2.3%, to ₹1,17,587.64/kilolitre in the national capital, according to a price notification of state-owned fuel retailers. Petrol and diesel prices, however, continued to remain on freeze for a record eighth consecutive month. Petrol costs ₹96.72/litre in the national capital, and diesel costs ₹89.62/litre.

165.title: Disappointed with selection for ODIs vs NZ, errors were made: Zaheer
165.article_body: Former India pacer Zaheer Khan said he was "disappointed" with the team selection for India's recently concluded ODI series against New Zealand. "The...selection [of the line-up] could have been better. There were definitely some errors being made, some unforced things which we saw," added Zaheer. "The Indian team wasn't really backing...[itself] to play that extra seamer," he stated.

166.title: Civil Aviation Minister Scindia launches DigiYatra at Delhi airport
166.article_body: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Thursday launched DigiYatra at the Delhi airport. DigiYatra facilitates paperless entry for passengers at airports and their data can be automatically processed based on a facial recognition system at various checkpoints, including security check areas. Passenger data will be saved in an encrypted format in a decentralised manner, Scindia said.

167.title: Wipro's unit acquires Pune-based startup Linecraft.AI
167.article_body: Wipro Infrastructure Engineering, an entity under Wipro Enterprises, on Thursday said it is acquiring Pune-based startup Linecraft.AI for an undisclosed amount. The startup's software collects and analyses large amounts of data from industrial machines and recommends ways to optimise efficiency, according to its website. Wipro said the acquisition will help it expand its digital capabilities.

168.title: Jharkhand Police reaches Raipur to arrest BJP candidate in rape case
168.article_body: A team of the Jharkhand Police has reached Chhattisgarh's Raipur to arrest BJP's Bhanupratappur Assembly bypoll candidate Brahmanand Netam in connection with a minor's gangrape case. The girl was allegedly first raped when she was nine and then trafficked and sexually assaulted by multiple accused across four states. Police said that five out of 10 accused have been arrested.

169.title: Aye Finance raises $10 mn from Swiss-based firm responsAbility
169.article_body: MSME lending startup Aye Finance has raised $10 million of ECB (External Commercial Borrowings) from Switzerland-based responsAbility Investments. Founded in 2014, Aye counts CapitalG, Elevation Capital, Lightrock and Alpha Wave among its backers. Speaking about the fundraise, Aye Finance MD said, "We are currently witnessing a surge in credit applications from the microenterprise sector."

170.title: Grasim to raise ₹1,000 crore through NCDs at 7.6% coupon
170.article_body: Aditya Birla Group's flagship company Grasim Industries Limited announced that it will raise ₹1,000 crore through the issuance of non-convertible debentures (NCDs) on a private placement basis. The NCDs offer investors a coupon rate of 7.63% per annum, with an annual interest payment till the redemption date. The shares of Grasim Industries ended 2.24% higher on the BSE on Thursday.

171.title: Man gets wife killed for insurance money of ₹1.9 crore in Rajasthan
171.article_body: A man got his wife killed to get an insurance amount of ₹1.9 crore in Rajasthan's Jaipur, police said. The woman along with her cousin was going to a temple on a motorcycle on the request of her husband on October 5, when an SUV hit their vehicle. The man hired a history-sheeter, who demanded ₹10 lakh.

172.title: Twitter must comply with our content moderation rules: EU warns Musk
172.article_body: Twitter must take significant steps to comply with EU content moderation laws, the bloc's digital chief Thierry Breton told Twitter CEO Elon Musk during a video call on Wednesday. "I welcome Musk's intent to get Twitter 2.0 ready for the Digital Services Act...Huge work ahead still," Breton later tweeted, adding, "Twitter will have to implement transparent user policies...tackle disinformation."

173.title: Sanjay Malhotra takes charge as new Revenue Secretary
173.article_body: Senior bureaucrat Sanjay Malhotra on Thursday took charge as the Secretary in the Department of Revenue, Ministry of Finance. Malhotra, a 1990-batch Indian Administrative Services (IAS) officer of the Rajasthan cadre, replaced Tarun Bajaj, who superannuated on November 30. Malhotra was previously working as an Officer on Special Duty (OSD) in the revenue department since October this year.

174.title: KSRTC to run e-buses between Bengaluru & Mysuru from Dec: Reports
