174.article_body: The Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) is set to reportedly run electric buses to cover the route between Bengaluru and Mysuru from this month. The KSRTC is also planning to use e-buses to link Bengaluru to other places, including Davanagere, Shivamogga and Madikeri. KSRTC has also sought suggestions from people for a display name and tagline for e-buses.

175.title: Jamadar in Allahabad High Court uses Paytm to receive tips; suspended
175.article_body: A Jamadar in Uttar Pradesh's Allahabad High Court was suspended for receiving tips through Paytm from lawyers inside the court premises. The action was taken after a photograph showing the Jamadar with Paytm QR code pasted on his waist went viral. A lawyer was also reportedly seen scanning the QR code to pay a tip to him in the picture.

176.title: Meghan Markle faced death threats as a royal: Ex-UK counterterrorism chief
176.article_body: Meghan Markle, Duchess of Sussex, faced "disgusting" threats to her life during her time in the royal family, former UK counterterrorism police chief Neil Basu said. The credible threats against Markle and her husband Prince Harry came from far-right extremists, Basu added. The couple, who stepped down as senior members of Britain's royal family in 2020, currently lives in California.

177.title: U'khand Assembly passes stricter anti-conversion Bill with up to 10-yr jail term
177.article_body: The Uttarakhand Assembly has passed a more stringent anti-conversion Bill making unlawful religious conversion a cognisable and non-bailable offence, punishable with imprisonment for a term between three years and 10 years. According to the Uttarakhand Freedom of Religion (Amendment) Act, 2022, a fine of at least ₹50,000 will also be imposed on any offender indulging in unlawful conversion.

178.title: Indian police acted quickly: S Korean YouTuber who was harassed by men in Mumbai
178.article_body: South Korean YouTuber Hyojeong Park, who was harassed by two men in Mumbai while she was live-streaming, praised the police for taking 'very quick action'. "(This) happened to me in another country too...that time I couldn't do anything to call the police," said Park. "I've been in Mumbai for over three weeks, (I'm) planning to stay longer," she added.

179.title: Messi is still no. 1, Ronaldo is among the top 3-5 players: Xavi
179.article_body: Barcelona manager Xavi said he considers Lionel Messi as the best player currently, adding that Cristiano Ronaldo is among the top three to five players. "If Messi wants to, he'll certainly be able to return to Barcelona at some point. Who wouldn't want to train him?" added Xavi. Messi represents PSG in club football while Ronaldo is a free agent.

180.title: 18-month-old baby consumes diesel kept in bottle, dies in Odisha
180.article_body: An 18-month-old baby died in Odisha's Balasore district after accidentally consuming diesel from a bottle his father had left unattended. According to police, the baby was playing in the house while his father was repairing his vehicle. After drinking diesel, the boy started vomiting and had difficulty in breathing. He was rushed to the hospital but couldn't be saved.

181.title: 4 lion cubs orphaned during Ukraine war arrive at US sanctuary
181.article_body: Four lion cubs, orphaned during the war in Ukraine, have arrived at The Wildcat Sanctuary in the US state of Minnesota. The sanctuary has pledged to provide the cubs with a permanent home. Three female cubs named Stefania, Lesya and Prada, and a male cub named Taras, spent the last three weeks at a zoo in Poland.

182.title: Big B's granddaughter Navya speaks on gender-equal boardrooms in India, people react
182.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya recently spoke at US Consulate. She spoke on working towards building gender-equal boardrooms in India. Reacting to it, a person tweeted, "What experience...do you have to provide inputs on such a sensitive...topic?" "I have a problem with an organisation matching...wrong person for...wrong...topic...and diluting [an] important discussion," a comment read.

183.title: India's human resources to be critical for global economy by 2030: Jaishankar
183.article_body: Union External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Thursday said that by end of the decade, India will be the most populous country and almost certainly be the third-largest economy in the world. "Our human resources will be critical for the global economy by 2030 in a world dominated by artificial intelligence," he said at the G20 University Connect in Delhi.

184.title: A Cong leader said I'll die dog's death, another said I'll die like Hitler: PM
184.article_body: Addressing a rally in Gujarat, PM Narendra Modi said, "Recently, [one Congress leader] said Modi will die a dog's death, another said Modi will die like Hitler, then they were waiting for Pakistan to kill me." "They call me Raavan, rakshas, and cockroach," PM Modi said. "Congress isn't aware...more muck you...throw, you'll see those many more lotuses blooming," he added.

185.title: Congress complains to EC about non-functional EVMs in 50 booths in Gujarat
185.article_body: The Opposition Congress submitted a complaint to the Election Commission on Thursday claiming electronic voting machines (EVMs) in at least 50 polling booths in Gujarat are not working after the first phase of the Assembly election began. In another complaint, Congress stated that electronic channels have been showing visual bytes of the BJP in a way that influences the voters.

186.title: Sensex closes at record high of 63,284, Nifty settles at all-time high of 18,812
186.article_body: The Sensex on Thursday closed at a record high of 63,284.19 and the Nifty 50 settled at an all-time high of 18,812.50. Both indices have risen 0.29%, with Sensex recording a 184.54-point hike and Nifty 50 recording a 54.15-point hike. Both Sensex and Nifty 50 have ended higher in the eight sessions since November 21.

187.title: Ang Lee to direct Bruce Lee's biopic, son Mason Lee to star in it
187.article_body: Oscar-winning director Ang Lee is set to helm martial arts legend Bruce Lee's biopic, which will star the filmmaker's son Mason Lee in the lead role. "I feel compelled to tell the story of this brilliant, unique human being who yearned for belonging...made impossible dreams into reality," Ang Lee said. The project is in development at Sony's 3000 Pictures.

188.title: Umran Malik shouldn't get confused about not leaking runs: Zaheer Khan
188.article_body: Ex-India pacer Zaheer Khan said pacer Umran Malik should target wickets even in case he is conceding runs. "If he's in that strike-rate zone of taking two-three wickets every game, then that is going to be the X-factor for him," added Zaheer. "Pace is something which he has to carry along...He shouldn't get confused about not leaking runs," he stated.

189.title: IFS officer shares observations after probe over Raveena Tandon's vehicle near tiger
189.article_body: After authorities at the Satpura Tiger Reserve launched probe against Raveena Tandon over her safari vehicle allegedly getting too close to a tiger, IFS officer Parveen Kaswan shared his observations. "My observation- permitted vehicle on approved road, visitors didn't disturb tiger, not making any noise, tiger was roaming on their own, growling towards...vehicle...is a normal thing," he tweeted.

190.title: Telangana CM's daughter K Kavitha named in Delhi liquor scam investigation
190.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao's daughter and state MLC K Kavitha has been named in an ED court filing on the Delhi liquor policy scam investigation. ED alleged that Kavitha is a member of the 'South Group'- a group of people who paid at least ₹100 crore in kickbacks to AAP leaders. She has denied the allegations.

191.title: BMC body to launch site for online treatment of HIV on World AIDS day
191.article_body: Mumbai District AIDS Control Society, an autonomous body established by the BMC, will launch a website named 'E-Nirantar' to render online services about HIV/AIDS to mark World AIDS Day. "People can book appointments for HIV testing and [those who have been diagnosed] can upload their reports, which will be examined by...doctors available on the platform," an official confirmed.

192.title: Andhra Police seize 800 kg donkey meat, rescue 100 animals in 2 months
192.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Police have seized over 800 kg of donkey meat in Bapatla, Guntur and Prakasam districts and rescued at least 100 donkeys kept for slaughter over the last two months. According to Bapatla SP Vakul Jindal, the animals were being slaughtered in unhygienic conditions. Donkey meat was in demand as it's believed to have healing properties, police added.

193.title: Farmer's son hides clearing IIT from family to join NDA, wins President's gold medal
193.article_body: Gaurav Yadav, the son of a Rajasthan farmer, hid from his family that he cleared the IIT entrance test to join the National Defence Academy (NDA). On Wednesday, he emerged as the President's gold medal winner of NDA's 143rd course. "We were confident about his success and never stopped him from doing what he loved," his parents said.

194.title: Doctor accused of raping sedated patients found dead in a ditch in US
194.article_body: A doctor accused of raping patients while they were under sedation has been found dead in a ditch near his home in US' Florida, according to authorities. Eric Salata, 54, allegedly carried out sex acts on two patients after giving them painkillers, laughing gas and alcohol. Salata was found with a gunshot wound to the head, according to police.

195.title: China eases COVID-19 lockdown in city with Foxconn's iPhone plant
195.article_body: The Chinese city of Zhengzhou, where Apple's biggest iPhone plant is located, has replaced its broad COVID-19 lockdown with curbs on hundreds of buildings. The shift came after China's top health officials asked local cadres to avoid excessive curbs following nationwide protests. However, Foxconn's iPhone plant is reportedly sticking with measures limiting workers' movement on campus.

196.title: Do we've any aukaat? We're sevaks: PM Modi on Cong's leader's remark
196.article_body: Referring to Congress leader Madhusudan Mistry's remark that Congress will show PM Narendra Modi his "aukaat" (status), PM Modi on Thursday said, "Do we have any aukaat? We are sevaks (servants)." PM Modi said this while speaking during a public rally in Gujarat on Thursday. Notably, the voting for the first phase of the Assembly elections in Gujarat began today.

197.title: Edtech startup Teachmint lays off 45 employees: Report
197.article_body: Edtech startup Teachmint reportedly laid off 45 employees, which is nearly 5% of its staff, across various departments. The company is offering a three-month severance package and health coverage to those laid off. Teachmint will expedite vesting of ESOPs (employee stock ownership plans) and reportedly also told affected employees they can apply for other roles within the company.

198.title: Man stabs landlord for failing to refund deposit in Mumbai; arrested
198.article_body: A man was arrested for stabbing his landlord after he failed to refund the rent deposit on time in Mumbai's Chembur. According to police, the 40-year-old man's two tenants entered his house and began verbally abusing him. One of them also started hitting the man, following which he pulled out a knife, stabbed him and fled the spot.

199.title: Thief who stole 6 phones from Mumbai's Andheri court canteen held
199.article_body: Mumbai Police on Tuesday arrested a 25-year-old man, Shoeb Shaikh, who allegedly stole six mobile phones belonging to employees of the Andheri Metropolitan Magistrate's Court's canteen last week. The incident took place around 4:13 am on Friday and the theft was captured on CCTV. "We laid a trap and caught him from his locality near...Andheri West," police said.

200.title: Clash breaks out over K'taka flag at Belagavi college fest amid border row with Maha
200.article_body: A clash broke out during an inter-college fest in Belagavi after some pro-Maharashtra students beat another student for allegedly holding up a traditional Karnataka flag. This comes amid the border dispute between Maharashtra and Karnataka. A purported video of the incident has surfaced online. Teachers and staff had intervened to stop the fight, the police reportedly said.

201.title: Iranian actress Soheila arrested after her protest video without headscarf goes viral
201.article_body: Iranian authorities have arrested actress Soheila Golestani, who appeared without her headscarf in a protest video, the US-based Human Rights Activists News Agency said. Director Hamid Pourazari who was seen in the video has also been arrested. The video showed a group of film and theatre figures standing silently without headscarves in solidarity with the ongoing protests in Iran.

202.title: 1,000 books set up in truck as part of Rahul's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
202.article_body: A mobile library comprising 1,000 books on subjects like politics, history and the lives of prominent leaders has been set up in a truck as part of Rahul Gandhi's ongoing 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. The front wall of the library carries a photograph of former PM Indira Gandhi. Though the library is functional, Rahul will inaugurate it on Thursday, reports said.

203.title: Saudi-based food delivery firm Jahez to buy rival Chefz for $173 mn
203.article_body: Saudi Arabia-based food delivery company Jahez has agreed to acquire rival platform The Chefz for around $173 million. As part of the deal, the founding members of The Chefz will also receive an earn-out amount of around $26 million in cash, subject to certain performance-related targets. Last year, Saudi Arabia's regulators rejected Delivery Hero's offer to acquire The Chefz.

204.title: Mumbai's air quality deteriorates from 'moderate' to 'poor', AQI at 221
204.article_body: Mumbai's overall Air Quality Index (AQI) slipped from 'moderate' to 'poor' category on Thursday. According to System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting And Research (SAFAR), the city recorded an AQI of 221 at 11:35 am. Worli's AQI stood at 180 ('moderate' category). Meanwhile, Andheri and Malad recorded an AQI of 235 ('poor' category) and 313 ('very poor' category) respectively.

205.title: Vodafone Idea in talks with SBI for up to ₹16,000 crore loan: Report
205.article_body: Vodafone Idea (Vi) has approached the SBI for a loan of ₹15,000-16,000 crore, The Economic Times reported. The company needs the loan to tackle its immediate 4G capex needs, fund gear supply contracts for its pending 5G rollout and clear vendor dues. The funding plan is currently stalled as SBI wants clarity on Centre’s potential shareholding in Vi, report said.

206.title: Adani Green raises $200 mn via yen-denominated refinancing facility
206.article_body: Adani Green Energy Limited on Thursday announced raising a Japanese yen-denominated refinancing facility worth nearly $200 million through its subsidiary Adani Solar Energy AP Six Private Limited. The facility is linked to the Tokyo Overnight Average Rate and comprises 27,954 million yen amortising project loans. The funds will be used to refinance the 350 MW solar project in Andhra Pradesh.

207.title: Rapido rider accused in B'luru gangrape was arrested before for assault
207.article_body: A Rapido rider who has been accused of gangraping a woman along with his friend in Bengaluru's Electronic City recently was arrested earlier this year on charges including assault, an official said. Bengaluru Police will also issue a notice to Rapido amid concerns over the company's verification process for employees. The accused had reportedly been working for Rapido since 2019.

208.title: Twitter expands 'recommended tweets' to all users
208.article_body: Twitter has said the platform is "expanding recommendations to all users, including those who may not have seen them in the past". "We want to ensure everyone on Twitter sees the best content," Twitter said. According to a Twitter blog on recommendations, users are shown content from accounts they don't follow "based on actions" taken by them on the platform.

209.title: Outsiders get lot of credit, while star kids are pulled down: Tusshar
209.article_body: Tusshar Kapoor said it's unfair that people who come from outside of the film industry get a lot of credit, while "there's...concerted effort to pull" star kids or people with film lineage down. "That's not fair because success and achievement [are] equally hard for anybody. There're no free lunches for people who're from inside...except for the first film," he added.

210.title: Taliban bans Voice of America's radio broadcast in Afghanistan
210.article_body: Taliban authorities have banned news platforms Voice of America (VOA) and Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty's FM broadcasts in Afghanistan, VOA said. The country's Foreign Ministry spokesperson said that Afghanistan has press laws and any network "repeatedly contravening" them won't be allowed to work. The two platforms "failed to show professionalism and were therefore shut down", he added.

211.title: Indian economy set to achieve 6.8-7% GDP growth this fiscal: CEA
211.article_body: The Indian economy is on track to achieve a 6.8-7% GDP growth in the current fiscal, Chief Economic Adviser V Anantha Nageswaran said on Wednesday. He added that festival sales, PMI, bank credit growth and auto sales data show that the economy has maintained momentum despite global headwinds. India's economy grew by 6.3% in the July-September quarter of this fiscal.

212.title: 1 killed, many injured in clashes between BJP and CPI(M) supporters
212.article_body: One person was killed and many were injured when clashes erupted between the supporters of BJP and CPI(M) in Tripura's Charilam on Wednesday, said an official. While CPI(M) claimed that Deputy CM Jishnu Dev Varma was behind the attack, Tripura minister Sushanta Chowdhury said the clashes were part of a "deep rooted conspiracy" hatched by CPI(M).

213.title: Recreation requires talent: Pak actor on Malaika's 'Aap Jaisa...' remix
213.article_body: Pakistani actor Adnan Siddiqui took to Twitter and opened up about the remixed version of 'Aap Jaisa Koi' featuring Malaika Arora in Ayushmann Khurrana's 'An Action Hero'. "Is there something in the air that the world has suddenly developed a penchant for ruining perfect classics? Even recreation requires talent. Nazia Hassan must be turning in her grave," Adnan tweeted.

214.title: Zuckerberg calls Apple's content moderation rules a 'conflict of interest'
214.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg has called Apple's content moderation rules for apps a "conflict of interest" since they are often pointed at rivals. "It's problematic for one company to be able to control what app experiences end up on a device," Zuckerberg said. "[The] vast majority of profits in mobile ecosystem go towards Apple," he added.

215.title: MoooFarm raises $13 million from Aavishkaar Capital and others
215.article_body: Agritech and dairy startup MoooFarm has secured $13 million in a Series A funding round led by Aavishkaar Capital. The round also saw participation from Accel Partners, Aditya Birla Ventures, and existing investors including Rockstart AgriFood, Navus Ventures and Alteria Capital. The startup was co-founded by Jitesh Arora, Param Singh, Aashna Singh and Abhijeet Mittal in 2019.

216.title: He paid every person back: Paresh on Amitabh's financial woes in 90s
216.article_body: Actor Paresh Rawal spoke about the time when Amitabh Bachchan suffered financial crisis in the 90s. "He owed people so much money...He could've hidden behind the law...but he chose to pay every single person back. These are his values," the actor recalled. Years ago, Bachchan expressed that he was "bankrupt" after his company Amitabh Bachchan Corporation Ltd went into debt.

217.title: 4 African nationals arrested for running job racket in Pune
217.article_body: Four African nationals, including two women, have been arrested in Pune for running an online job racket. Police have recovered a database of 2 lakh email IDs and over one lakh mobile numbers from them. Police had launched a probe after a man complained he was duped of ₹26 lakh under the pretext of offering a job in the USA.

218.title: England break world record for scoring most runs in first session of a Test match
218.article_body: England have broken the world record for scoring most runs in the first session of a Test match. England scored 174/0 in 27 overs in the first session of their first Test against Pakistan in Rawalpindi on Thursday. The previous record was held by India, who scored 158/0 in the first session of their Test against Afghanistan in 2018.

219.title: Come to Ukraine & then tell us how to end this war: Zelenskyy to Musk
219.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Wednesday criticised billionaire Elon Musk's proposal to end Russia's offensive in Ukraine. "If you want to understand what Russia has done here, come to Ukraine and you will see this with your own eyes...After that, you will tell us how to end this war, who started and when we can end it," Zelenskyy added.

220.title: India's growth rate may have peaked, slowdown underway: Nomura
220.article_body: Financial holding company Nomura said that India's growth cycle may have already peaked and a broad-based slowdown is underway. This comes even as the government has expressed confidence that the latest GDP numbers showed the economic recovery was gaining momentum. India posted annual economic growth of 6.3% in the July-September quarter of the current fiscal year.

221.title: Cricketer Rajeshwari involved in altercation with supermarket staff, her friends beat him
221.article_body: India Women cricketer Rajeshwari Gayakwad was involved in an altercation with a staff member of a supermarket in Vijayapura. A video has surfaced online wherein Gayakwad and the staff member were seen arguing over something. After a while, Gayakwad's friends were seen beating up the staff member. As per reports, no police complaint was filed in the case.

222.title: 3 girls get stuck in society's lift for over 20 mins in Ghaziabad; case filed
222.article_body: A case has been filed after a CCTV video of three girls who got stuck in the elevator of a housing society in Ghaziabad for over 20 minutes went viral. The incident took place in 'Assotech The Nest' society. In the video, the girls can be seen crying, trying to force open the lift's door and pressing the buttons.

223.title: BJP Gujarat candidate injured after stones pelted on his car
223.article_body: BJP candidate Piyush Patel, who is contesting election from Vansda constituency, suffered injuries on his head after he was allegedly attacked while travelling with his supporters from Pratapnagar to Vandervela village on Wednesday. Patel said that some people pelted stones and attempted to vandalise his car. BJP has blamed supporters of Congress candidate Anant Patel for the attack.

224.title: There's a competition in Congress on who can abuse me more: PM Modi
224.article_body: Referring to Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge's 'Raavan' comment, PM Narendra Modi said that there is a competition going on inside the Congress on who can abuse Modi more. "Every leader is aiming to make the abuses bigger...and more acerbic," PM Modi said. "Those who never believed in the existence of Lord Ram have now brought in....'Raavan' from Ramayana," he added.

225.title: IAF's Chetak helicopter makes emergency landing in Pune, crew safe
225.article_body: A Chetak helicopter of the Indian Air Force (IAF) on Thursday made an emergency landing in an open area of Baramati airfield in Maharashtra's Pune district. IAF's PRO Wing Commander Ashish Moghe said the precautionary landing was carried out due to a suspected technical issue in the helicopter. He added that both the crew and the aircraft are safe.

226.title: Scientists simulate a 'baby wormhole' using a quantum computer for 1st time
226.article_body: Scientists have developed a quantum experiment that allows them to study the behaviour of a special kind of theoretical wormhole for the first time. The experiment hasn't created an actual wormhole (a rupture in space and time), rather it allows probing connections between theoretical wormholes and quantum physics. It was a "baby wormhole," according to Caltech physicist Maria Spiropulu.

227.title: In T20s, you survive as there's no slip: Jaffer on Suryakumar's ODI dismissals
227.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said Suryakumar Yadav was dismissed in the same manner in the first and third clash of the three-match ODI series recently played against New Zealand, having been caught at slips. "In T20s, there's no slip, so you survive...People are now talking [about] how he may play Tests...he needs to improve on this," added Jaffer.

228.title: Didn't want to have 'chamkeele' word in 'Dil Chahta Hai' song: Farhan
228.article_body: Actor-director Farhan Akhtar said he didn't want 'chamkeele' word in the title track of 'Dil Chahta Hai'. "I said, 'That's too detergent a word, we can't have this in song'," he expressed. However, lyricist and his father Javed Akhtar insisted on keeping the word and assured that it would become USP of the song. The film marked Farhan's directorial debut.

229.title: PCMC to set up postmortem centre with capacity to store 60 bodies
229.article_body: Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has decided to set up a new and well-equipped postmortem centre with a storage capacity of 60 bodies and dissection facility. This comes after two bodies were mistakenly swapped at the civic body-run Yashwantrao Chavan Memorial Hospital in October. The new centre will come up near the existing one at the hospital, according to officials.

230.title: Musk shares video of monkey typing with its mind using Neuralink's brain chip
230.article_body: Elon Musk on Thursday shared a video showing a monkey implanted with his company Neuralink's brain chip performing 'telepathic typing' using a virtual keyboard. "He's not actually using a keyboard, he's moving the cursor with his mind to the highlighted key," explained Musk. "He's not strapped to the chair or anything. The monkeys actually enjoy doing the demos," said Musk.

231.title: I didn't ever try to commit fraud: Bankrupt crypto exchange FTX's founder
231.article_body: Bankrupt crypto exchange FTX's Founder Sam Bankman-Fried has said that he "didn't ever try to commit fraud" and doesn't think he has criminal liability. Bankman-Fried told The New York Times that he is in the Bahamas and was giving interview against his lawyers' advice. As FTX collapsed, Bankman-Fried lost his billionaire status as his $16 billion fortune was wiped out.

232.title: Urgent need to finalise EU crypto rules after FTX collapse: European Commission
232.article_body: A senior European Commission official has said that "questionable practices" at bankrupt crypto exchange FTX would not have been allowed to happen under the EU rules that need to be finalised urgently. Alexandra Jour-Schroeder said that there was no proper record keeping at FTX. The EU has reached an agreement on Markets in Crypto-Assets (MiCA) regulations for licencing and supervision.

233.title: Nazara Technologies Founder Nitish Mittersain takes charge as CEO
233.article_body: Gaming and sports media platform Nazara Technologies Founder Nitish Mittersain has taken charge as CEO of the company with effect from Thursday. Mittersain tweeted, "I'm back as Nazara CEO from today and look forward to making a strong impact filled with positive intent and hard work!" Nazara had announced in October that Manish Agarwal would step down as CEO.

234.title: Gujarat polls are semi-finals for 2024 Lok Sabha elections: Desai
234.article_body: The ongoing Assembly elections in Gujarat are the "semi-finals" for the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, the state's Finance Minister Kanu Desai said. He added that every person in Gujarat has decided to vote for BJP. "People will decide how many seats BJP will get, but I can say it's 100% that BJP will come to govern the state," Desai said.

235.title: College student stripped & filmed by his classmates, blackmailed for ₹60,000 in Dehradun
235.article_body: A first-year BBA student in Dehradun's private university UPES was allegedly made to strip and forced to drink alcohol by three of his classmates. The 19-year-old was also allegedly assaulted and filmed by the accused in his hostel room. They allegedly blackmailed him using the video and demanded ₹60,000 from him, after which he filed a police complaint.

236.title: In pics: President Murmu hands out National Sports Awards 2022
236.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sharath Kamal was awarded the Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award by President Droupadi Murmu during the award ceremony for the National Sports Awards 2022. The Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award is the highest award for any Indian sportsperson. The Arjuna Award was bestowed to 25 athletes, including shuttler Lakshya Sen and boxer Nikhat Zareen.

237.title: Ravish posts 1st video after resigning from NDTV, says 'The bird is unable to see its nest'
237.article_body: Senior journalist Ravish Kumar posted first video on YouTube after he resigned as senior executive editor of NDTV. "You are all included in my being. Your love is my wealth...Everyone has to fight against the slavery of Godi media," he tweeted. "The bird is unable to find its nest... maybe someone took the nest away from the bird," he said.

238.title: Biden to host 1st state dinner of his presidency for France's Macron
238.article_body: US President Joe Biden will host the first state dinner of his presidency for his French counterpart Emmanuel Macron, who is in Washington. Ahead of the dinner, the two leaders will meet at the Oval Office to discuss issues including joint response to the Russian invasion of Ukraine. On Wednesday, Macron and US Vice President Kamala Harris visited NASA headquarters.

239.title: Twitter purging lot of spam accounts, users may see follower count drop: Musk
239.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk on Thursday said the platform is "purging a lot of spam/scam accounts" because of which users may see their "follower count drop". Prior to Musk's takeover, Twitter had claimed that less than 5% of its daily active users were fake or spam accounts. Musk had denied the claim, saying the actual figure was "wildly higher".

240.title: Remake of Mahesh Bhatt's 'Arth' has been postponed for now: Revathy
240.article_body: Actress-director Revathy shared that the remake of Mahesh Bhatt's 'Arth' has been "postponed for now". "That project didn't fall into place with the right actors," she said, adding that the film isn't a "faithful remake" of the 1982 release. "We're actually doing a take on the subject (of the film), an idea that remained unexplored in the original," she added.

241.title: Gates Foundation-backed agritech startup Cropin to raise $50-$70 mn
241.article_body: Agritech startup Cropin, backed by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, will raise $50-$70 million as a part of its Series D funding round, Founder and CEO Krishna Kumar said. The round is expected to be closed in three to four months, he added. With this new investment, the Bengaluru-based startup will have raised a total of $80-$100 million.

242.title: Teen sodomises 10-yr-old boy in Gr Noida; sent to correction home
242.article_body: A 17-year-old boy was sent to a correction home after he allegedly sodomised a 10-year-old boy in Greater Noida. The incident took place earlier in November, however, the victim's family filed a complaint on Tuesday. The victim's parents said that their son was playing outside the house when the suspect "lured him to an empty room" nearby, the SHO said.

243.title: Sale of alcohol banned in Delhi for 3 days from tomorrow due to MCD polls
243.article_body: Due to the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) elections, the sale of alcohol will be prohibited in the national capital for three days from tomorrow, the Delhi excise department announced. Polling for MCD's 250 wards is scheduled to take place on December 4. The department also announced that a dry day will be observed on December 7.

244.title: 'Sexually explicit' video of Delhi judicial officer surfaces, HC orders blocking it
244.article_body: The Delhi High Court has ordered that a "sexually explicit" video purportedly showing a judicial officer with a woman is blocked from circulating on social media. The video, which was recorded in March 2022, has been doing the rounds online since November 29. Notices have been issued to the Centre and the relevant social media platforms in this regard.

245.title: Delhi Police moves HC against Tharoor's discharge in wife's death case
245.article_body: Delhi High Court has issued a notice to Congress MP Shashi Tharoor after Delhi Police appealed against the trial court's order discharging him in his wife Sunanda Pushkar's death case. The lawyer representing Tharoor objected to the 15-month delay in filing the review plea. However, the judge issued a notice on Delhi Police's application seeking condonation of delay.

246.title: Islamic State leader was killed in mid-Oct by Free Syrian Army: US
246.article_body: The US military on Wednesday said Islamic State (ISIS) militant leader Abu al-Hassan al-Hashimi al-Qurayshi was killed by the rebel Free Syrian Army in mid-October in Syria's Daraa province. No US military troops were involved in the operation, it added. The Islamic State has selected Abu al-Hussein al-Husseini al-Quraishi as its new leader, a spokesperson for the militant group said.

247.title: 5 drunk men attack restaurant staff after being denied food in B'luru
247.article_body: Five men have been arrested for attacking staff at a restaurant in Bengaluru's Electronic City on Wednesday. The incident happened after the drunk men entered the restaurant at around 11.20 pm and demanded that food be served to them. The staff working there declined to provide food, saying that the time for the last order was 11 pm.

248.title: What is the nearly 50,000-yr-old 'zombie virus' revived by scientists recently?
248.article_body: Thirteen ancient viruses frozen in Siberian permafrost (permanently frozen ground) were recently revived by French scientists. These are called 'zombie viruses' as they have remained dormant since the prehistoric times. The oldest of these viruses is a 48,500-year-old amoeba virus named Pandoravirus yedoma, which was found at the bottom of a lake in Yakutia, Russia.

249.title: Ravish posts 1st video after resigning from NDTV, says 'We've to fight Godi media'
249.article_body: Senior journalist Ravish Kumar posted first video on YouTube after he resigned as senior executive editor of NDTV. "You are all included in my being. Your love is my wealth...Everyone has to fight against the slavery of Godi media," he tweeted. "I have received something or the other from everyone. I'm thankful to everyone," he said about his colleagues.

250.title: 'Satyameva...' was trolled for action, same shots were in 'RRR': Milap
250.article_body: Filmmaker Milap Zaveri recalled that his film 'Satyameva Jayate 2' was trolled for its action sequences. "Same kind of action was seen in 'RRR' and 'KGF'," he said. Milap added, "John lifted the bike with two hands. But Jr NTR...lifted the bike with one hand. The conviction was the same but the story was better...I failed at the story level."

251.title: Swara Bhasker joins Rahul Gandhi in Bharat Jodo Yatra in MP
251.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker joined Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in Bharat Jodo Yatra in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain on Thursday. Sharing a picture of Bhaskar walking alongside Gandhi, the party tweeted, "The presence of every section of the society has made this march a success." Many celebrities, including Amol Palekar, Pooja Bhatt and Riya Sen, have participated in the march so far.

252.title: Man rapes woman inside bus in B'luru, caught during fight with her son
252.article_body: A driver was arrested for allegedly raping a woman inside an empty bus in Bengaluru. The incident took place on Tuesday evening when the accused took the woman, who was alone in the bus, to a service road and raped her. The woman informed her son about it, following which the victim's son and the driver got into a fight.

253.title: Steve Smith equals Don Bradman's tally of hundreds in Test cricket
253.article_body: Australia batter Steve Smith on Thursday equalled Don Bradman's tally of hundreds in Test cricket by smashing his 29th hundred in the longest format of the game. Smith achieved the feat by reaching the three-figure mark on Day 2 of the first Test against West Indies in Perth. Smith took 155 innings to reach 29 Test hundreds.

254.title: Hong Kong postpones trial of tabloid Apple Daily's founder Jimmy Lai
254.article_body: The trial of Hong Kong's now-defunct pro-democracy tabloid Apple Daily's founder Jimmy Lai has been postponed after Chief Executive John Lee asked China whether Lai can hire a British lawyer. Lai faces charges of sedition and collusion with foreign forces to endanger national security. The 74-year-old faces possible life sentence if convicted under the National Security Law imposed by China.

255.title: He should respect the conditions: Shastri on Suryakumar's dismissals
255.article_body: Discussing Suryakumar Yadav's dismissals in the ODI series against New Zealand, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said, "You've to respect the conditions." "This is a great game. It doesn't wait for anyone," added Shastri. "It's about giving himself that extra bit of time," stated Shastri. Suryakumar scored 44 runs in the ODI series and had a strike rate of 115.78.

256.title: Bret Taylor to step down as Co-CEO of Salesforce
256.article_body: Salesforce on Wednesday announced its Co-CEO Bret Taylor will step down from his position in January, leaving Co-founder Marc Benioff to be the sole CEO. Taylor, who was given the role last year, had joined Salesforce in 2016 after his startup Quip was acquired by the software firm. He played a key role in Salesforce's $27.7 billion acquisition of Slack.

257.title: Congress MLA goes to vote with LPG cylinder on cycle in Gujarat
257.article_body: A video of Congress MLA Paresh Dhanani going to cast his vote for the Gujarat Assembly elections while carrying an LPG cylinder on a cycle has surfaced online. "Inflation and joblessness have increased in Gujarat due to the failure of BJP government. Gas and fuel prices have skyrocketed," he said. Voting for the first phase of the election began today.

258.title: Leap.club raises $1 million from Mamaearth Co-founder, others
258.article_body: Leap.club on Thursday said that it has raised $1 million in a funding round led by existing investor Enzia Ventures. Mamaearth Co-founder Ghazal Alagh, Artha India Ventures and Netflix's ex-marketing head Swati Mohan were among others who participated in the round. Founded by former Zomato executives Ragini Das and Anand Sinha, Leap.club is a professional networking platform for women.

259.title: I believe we can go further than we did before: PM as India assumes G20 Presidency
259.article_body: As India assumed Presidency of G20 forum on Thursday, PM Narendra Modi, in an editorial, said the previous Presidencies delivered significant results. He added, "I ask myself- can the G20 go further still? Can we catalyse a fundamental mindset shift to benefit humanity as a whole? I believe we can." He added, "We remain trapped in the same zero-sum mindset."

260.title: India's unemployment rate rises to 8% in Nov, highest in 3 months: CMIE
260.article_body: India's unemployment rate surged to 8% in November from 7.77% in October, according to the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE) data. This is the highest in three months, the data showed. The urban unemployment rate increased to 8.96% in November from 7.21% in October, while the rural unemployment rate fell to 7.55% from 8.04%, according to the data.

261.title: I got really scared: Babil on life after Irrfan Khan's death
261.article_body: Irrfan Khan's son Babil Khan shared that he "got really scared" after his father passed away in 2020. "The protection that Baba (Irrfan) gave me...was suddenly gone...it was extremely difficult," he recalled. However, he shared that the team of 'Qala' and their love and concern gave him strength. "It made me feel I'm okay...I'll be fine," Babil added.

262.title: This winter, glow naturally with Mamaearth Honey Malai: Mamaearth
262.article_body: Mamaearth stated that it's bringing back age-old skincare secret of honey & malai with its new campaign, #IssWinterGlowNaturally, with brand ambassador, Shilpa Shetty Kundra. The film highlights brand's ideology of bringing the wisdom of homemade recipes in easy-to-use formats with natural goodness & no toxins, the brand said, adding that, this winter, glow naturally with Mamaearth Honey & Malai.

263.title: 3 girls get stuck in society's lift for over 20 mins in Ghaziabad; case filed
263.article_body: A case has been filed after a CCTV video of three girls who got stuck in the elevator of a housing society in Ghaziabad for over 20 minutes went viral. The incident took place in 'Assotech The Nest' society. In the video, the girls can be seen crying, trying to force open the lift's door and pressing the buttons.

264.title: Ruined my family's life with crazy passion for theatre: Piyush Mishra
264.article_body: Actor Piyush Mishra said that his "crazy passion for theatre" ruined his and his family's life. The actor expressed that theatre is not a "feasible work option to keep your house running" and take care of a family. He further said that nowadays, he does films "to earn money" and keep his "family afloat".

265.title: Pant has been doing well, Sanju Samson needs to wait: Shikhar Dhawan
265.article_body: Shikhar Dhawan, who was India's stand-in captain for the ODI series against New Zealand, termed Rishabh Pant as a "match-winner", adding he'll be backed, having scored a century in India's ODIs against England. "Sanju Samson's doing...well...Sometimes...a player has to wait because the one before him...[is] doing well," added Dhawan. Pant scored 25 runs in the ODI series against New Zealand.

266.title: UP doctor jailed for 20 yrs for raping 12-yr-old girl in his clinic
266.article_body: A special POCSO court in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi sentenced a doctor to 20 years in prison for raping a 12-year-old girl in his clinic in the city on several occasions. The court also imposed a fine of ₹1,65,000 on the 37-year-old doctor. The accused, Dr Shailendra Chauhan, used to allegedly call the minor girl to his clinic to teach her.

267.title: 27-year-old Iranian man shot dead by authorities for celebrating World Cup exit
267.article_body: A 27-year-old Iranian man named Mehran Samak was shot dead by Iranian authorities for celebrating Iran's exit from 2022 FIFA World Cup. He was killed in Bandar Anzali, Oslo-based group Iran Human Rights (IHR) stated. This comes as anti-government demonstrations took place across Iran after they lost to USA in their last group stage match.

268.title: World champion boxer Canelo Alvarez apologises to Lionel Messi for threatening him
268.article_body: World champion boxer Canelo Alvarez has apologised to Lionel Messi for threatening him after claiming the Argentinian footballer disrespected Mexican flag after stomping on it. He stated that he got carried away by the "passion and love" he feels for his country and made comments that were out of place. Alvarez had threatened Messi after Argentina's 2-0 win over Mexico.

269.title: Female influencer kicks dog in the face, abuses it; apologises after video goes viral
269.article_body: A female influencer has apologised after a video showing her kicking a dog in the face and abusing it went viral on social media. In the apology video, the influencer claimed that she is an "animal lover", and wrote, "I am sorry for my cruel act...I regret my actions...I vow to not harm animals."

270.title: List of world's most expensive cities in 2022 released
270.article_body: New York and Singapore have been tied for the top spot on the list of the world's most expensive cities, as per the latest EIU Worldwide Cost of Living survey. Israel's Tel Aviv, China's Hong Kong, LA in the US, and Zurich in Switzerland are also on the list. Geneva, San Francisco and Paris are also among the top 10.

271.title: India's manufacturing PMI rises to 55.7 in November
271.article_body: India's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) compiled by S&P Global, which measures manufacturing sector activity, surged to 55.7 in November from 55.3 in October. This is the 17th consecutive 50-plus print for the manufacturing PMI. "It was business as usual for goods producers, who lifted production volumes to the greatest extent in three months," S&P noted.

272.title: Musk's Neuralink plans to implant wireless device in human brain in 6 months
272.article_body: Elon Musk on Wednesday said that a wireless device developed by his brain chip company Neuralink is expected to begin human clinical trials in six months, adding, "We've submitted I think most of our paperwork to the FDA." The company is developing brain chip interfaces that it says could enable disabled patients to move and communicate again.

273.title: 4 people killed as car rams into parked truck in Odisha
273.article_body: Four people were killed on the spot after their car rammed into a parked truck on the roadside on National Highway 16 in Odisha's Khordha district on Thursday, police said. The accident took place when the occupants of the car were travelling from Visakhapatnam in Andhra Pradesh to Puri. The victims were aged between 25 and 35 years.

274.title: 2 men who harassed Korean woman YouTuber during livestream in Mumbai arrested
274.article_body: Two men, who harassed a female YouTuber from South Korea in Mumbai, have been arrested, Khar Police said on Thursday. The men were identified as Mobeen Chand Mohammad Shaikh and Mohammad Naqeeb Sadrealam Ansari. A video posted to Twitter earlier showed one of the men grabbing the YouTuber's hand while offering her a lift and trying to kiss her.

275.title: 2 killed, dozens missing as landslide hits highway in Brazil
275.article_body: Two people were killed and dozens went missing after a landslide hit a highway in the city of Guaratuba in the Brazilian state of Parana. Emergency services have rescued six people, including the Mayor of Guaratuba. The landslide was triggered after days of continuous torrential rains. A section of the highway was swept away, along with 20 cars and trucks.

276.title: Man hit by buffalo gets crushed under bus in Mumbai, son seeks probe
276.article_body: A 68-year-old man got run over by a bus and died after he was dashed by a buffalo on the road in Mumbai, said police. The victim's son, however, said that the CCTV footage didn't show the buffalo dashing him as it was a few metres away. He sought a probe to check if the bus driver was at fault.

277.title: Foreign investors showing interest in India: Goldman Sachs top exec
277.article_body: As India is ramping up manufacturing capacity and improving infrastructure, foreign investors are showing interest in Asia's third-largest economy, Chief India Economist at Goldman Sachs Santanu Sengupta said. As manufacturing firms look to diversify away from China, he said, India will attract a large share of global inbound manufacturing FDI if it is able to capitalise on this opportunity.

278.title: I was wrong in not believing in ad-based model: Netflix Co-CEO
278.article_body: Netflix Co-CEO Reed Hastings on Wednesday said that he was "wrong" about not believing in an ad-supported model for the streaming platform. "Hulu proved you could do that at scale and offer customers lower prices," he stated. Though Netflix now offers an ad-based model in select countries, Hastings said, "I wish we had flipped a few years earlier on it."

279.title: File FIRs against land encroachers: CEO of Noida, Gr Noida authorities
279.article_body: The CEO of both Noida and Greater Noida authorities, Ritu Maheshwari, has directed officials to identify the government's notified land earmarked for well-planned development and file FIRs against people found encroaching on this land. Following this, the land department of Noida authority said that it has demolished at least 30 farmhouses which were built illegally on the Yamuna floodplain.

280.title: Whale vomit worth ₹5 crore seized by Pune Police; 5 arrested
280.article_body: Pune Police arrested five persons for allegedly smuggling ambergris, also known as whale vomit, worth around ₹5 crore. Acting on a tip-off, the police conducted searches and recovered 2.994 kg of ambergris from one suspect and 2.286 kg of the substance from another. Ambergris is a costly substance originating from the digestive system of sperm whales.

281.title: I'm willing to die for him: Chicharito on Aguero's spat with boxer Alvarez
281.article_body: Reacting to the ongoing spat between ex-Argentina forward Sergio Aguero and world champion boxer Canelo Alvarez over the latter's threat to Lionel Messi, Mexico forward Javier Hernández (Chicharito) said, "I'm...here to defend Aguero." "I will die for Aguero," added Chicharito. Alvarez had threatened Messi for allegedly disrespecting the Mexican flag, resulting in Aguero defending the latter.

282.title: Arjun posts about 'karma' after fake news about Malaika's pregnancy surfaces
282.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor posted about 'karma' on Instagram after criticising a news portal for sharing fake news about his girlfriend Malaika Arora being pregnant. "Karma comes after everyone eventually. You can't get away with screwing people over your whole life...What goes around comes around. That's how it works," said Kapoor. He had earlier called the news about Malaika's pregnancy "garbage".

283.title: Didn't want to insult those who suffered, I'm sorry: Lapid on The Kashmir Files remarks
283.article_body: Amid controversy over his remarks on 'The Kashmir Files', Israeli filmmaker Nadav Lapid has apologised, saying, "My aim was never to insult people or their relatives, who have suffered." He however claimed that the film was included in the IFFI competition due to "political pressure". Lapid had called 'The Kashmir Files' a propaganda film, triggering a row.

284.title: Woman claims actor Mohan Kapur 'sent d**k pics' when she was 15, 'asked for nudes'
284.article_body: A woman has claimed that actor Mohan Kapur "sent d**k pictures" to her when she was 15 and "asked for nudes". "Said things like how he was in love with me, wanted to marry me," she tweeted. "His partner (now ex) knew the type of man he was...She was aware that he was talking to me,' the woman added.

285.title: I bet Lionel Messi €100 that it won't be a penalty, I lost it: Poland goalkeeper
285.article_body: Talking about the penalty awarded to Argentina after his hand hit Lionel Messi's face during their 2022 FIFA World Cup match, Poland goalkeeper Wojciech Szczęsny said he bet Messi €100 it won't be a penalty. "I've lost a bet against Messi." "I don’t know if that’s allowed at the World Cup...I’m probably going to get banned for it!" he joked.

286.title: Nadav Lapid says 'Kashmir Files' has 'fascist features', Vivek reacts
286.article_body: Vivek Agnihotri has reacted to Israeli filmmaker Nadav Lapid's remark that 'The Kashmir Files' has "fascist features". He tweeted, "What is common between these? 'India is a fascist country'...'Abrogation of Art 370 a fascist decision'...'The Kashmir Files' is a fascist film'." Earlier, Nadav called 'The Kashmir Files' a "propaganda" and "vulgar" film. He later apologised for his comments.

287.title: S African Prez faces impeachment debate for allegedly violating oath of office
287.article_body: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa faces an impeachment debate after a panel found preliminary evidence that he violated his oath of office in an alleged robbery cover-up case. A robbery of an estimated $4 million at Ramaphosa's private farm, Phala Phala, in 2020, raised questions about how he acquired the wealth and whether he declared it. Ramaphosa denied any wrongdoing.

288.title: Woman jumps from cable bridge into Hyderabad lake, rescued
288.article_body: A woman aged about 19 years reportedly jumped into Durgam Cheruvu lake from the cable bridge in Hyderabad on Tuesday. The Madhapur patrol mobile police changed their course after noticing the incident, while Durgam Cheruvu lake police arrived at the scene on a boat. Sub-inspector Bhanu Prakash and boat driver Manohar managed to rescue the woman.

289.title: Jadeja shares video of Balasaheb saying Guj 'nothing without Modi'
289.article_body: Cricketer Ravindra Jadeja on Wednesday shared a video of Shiv Sena founder Balasaheb Thackeray in which he said that "if [PM] Narendra Modi isn't there, Gujarat is nothing". He captioned the video, "Abhi bhi time hai samaj jao Gujaratiyo (There's still time, understand this people of Gujarat)." Ravindra's wife Rivaba Jadeja has been fielded by BJP for Gujarat Assembly elections.

290.title: Had no clue about Gulzar, didn't see Shabana's films: Shweta on Makdee
290.article_body: Shweta Basu Prasad said she hadn't seen any films of Shabana Azmi and had no clue about Gulzar when she started working on Vishal Bhardwaj's 'Makdee'. Shweta was 10 when she featured in the 2002 film. "I hadn't watched any film of hers (Shabana). I'd only seen 'Masoom' thanks to my mom...had no clue who Gulzar Saab was," she said.

291.title: DeHaat raises $60 mn in Series E round led by Sofina, Temasek
291.article_body: Agritech startup DeHaat has raised $60 million in a Series E round led by Sofina Ventures and Temasek. The round also saw participation from Prosus Ventures, RTP Global India and Lightrock India. Reportedly, the startup's valuation now stands between $700 million and $800 million. It plans to use the funding to add over a million farmers to its platform.

292.title: 6 MBBS interns at govt college suspended for ragging in Maharashtra
292.article_body: Six MBBS interns of the Government Medical College and Hospital in Maharashtra's Nagpur have been suspended for allegedly ragging a junior student, an official said. The junior student had sent a video of the incident to the Central Anti-Ragging Committee, a college official said. The college's Dean has also ordered the suspended students to vacate the hostel, the official added.

293.title: 4 foreigners pose as US Embassy officials, cheat Mumbai woman of ₹26 lakh
293.article_body: Four foreign nationals from Zambia, Uganda, Namibia and Ghana were arrested from Pune for posing as US Embassy officials and allegedly cheating a Mumbai woman of ₹26 lakh by promising her a job in America. They reportedly held an online interview and made phone calls to the woman to ascertain her identity. She was given an offer letter in April.

294.title: Will shut BBMP if 1 more official arrested: Staff on voter data case
294.article_body: BBMP Officers and Employees' Welfare Association chief Amrut Raj has threatened to shut down the civic body if any more officials are arrested in the alleged voter data fraud case. He added that the investigations by multiple agencies were a violation of the employees' human rights. Notably, four officers have been arrested by the police in the case.

295.title: US House Democrats elect Jeffries as 1st Black leader in Congress
295.article_body: US House Democrats on Wednesday elected New York congressman Hakeem Jeffries to succeed Nancy Pelosi as their leader in the House of Representatives. Jeffries is the first Black American to hold such a high-ranking position in Congress. "This new generation of leaders reflects the vibrancy and diversity of our great nation," Pelosi said in a congratulatory statement after the vote.

296.title: Sensex opens 400 points up, Nifty above 18,850, hit record highs
296.article_body: The benchmark indices opened at record highs on Thursday. The Sensex was up 383.98 points at 63,483.63 and the Nifty was up 100.50 points at 18,858.80. Tech Mahindra, Wipro, Infosys, Hindalco Industries and HCL Technologies were among the major gainers on the Nifty. The stocks of Bajaj Auto, SBI Life Insurance, HUL, Maruti Suzuki and Tata Consumer Products slipped.

297.title: We hate Suarez for handball in 2010, want revenge: Ex-Ghana player Ayew
297.article_body: Referring to Uruguay striker Luis Suarez's handball in the quarter-final of the 2010 FIFA World Cup against Ghana, ex-Ghana midfielder Ibrahim Ayew said, "The whole of Africa hates him...We want revenge." Suarez's handball on the goal-line in the last minute denied Ghana the winner. The game was eventually decided on the basis of a penalty shootout where Uruguay emerged victorious.

298.title: India takes over G20 Presidency today
298.article_body: India assumes the Presidency of the G20 or Group of 20 forum, which comprises of 19 countries and the European Union, on Thursday (December 1). The Presidency will be one-year-long and India's theme for the Presidency is "One Earth, One Family, One Future". PM Narendra Modi, while addressing G20 Summit in Bali said India's Presidency will be "ambitious" and "action-oriented".

299.title: Elon Musk posts video from Apple HQ, says 'misunderstanding resolved'
299.article_body: Elon Musk took to Twitter to post a video and wrote, "Thanks Tim Cook for taking me around Apple's beautiful HQ." "Among other things, we resolved the misunderstanding about Twitter potentially being removed from the App Store. Tim was clear that Apple never considered doing so," Musk added. Musk earlier claimed that Apple has stopped spending on Twitter ads.

300.title: Shah Rukh Khan wraps up Saudi Arabia schedule of 'Dunki', shares video
300.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan announced that he has wrapped up the Saudi Arabia schedule of his upcoming film 'Dunki'. He shared a video on Instagram and thanked the film's team and the Saudi Arabia Ministry of Culture for their warm hospitality. 'Dunki' marks Shah Rukh's first collaboration with Taapsee Pannu and director Rajkumar Hirani. It's scheduled to release in December 2023.

301.title: US Fed Reserve to slow pace of interest rate hikes: Jerome Powell
301.article_body: US Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Wednesday signalled that the central bank will slow the pace of interest rate increases next month while maintaining that the borrowing costs will remain high. "The time for moderating the pace of rate increases may come as soon as the December meeting," Powell said. The Federal Reserve meeting is scheduled on December 13-14.

302.title: Assam CM begins distribution of scooters to meritorious students
302.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Wednesday began the distribution of scooters to meritorious students who cleared the last higher secondary examinations. A total of 35,800 students, including 6,052 boys and 29,748 girls who scored over 75% and 60% respectively, will be given the scooters under the Dr Banikanta Kakati Merit Award. Sarma called it a "historic milestone" for students.

303.title: Foxconn offers $141 for referrals for China factory after unrest
303.article_body: Foxconn on Wednesday offered its staff a 1,000 yuan ($141.11) award to recommend people who can work at its China plant that recently saw violent protests. Under the offer, workers will receive 500 yuan if their recommended person stays for 15 days and 500 yuan more if they complete a month. The company has already increased bonuses for existing workers.

304.title: Pune Crime Branch policeman arrested for seeking ₹2 lakh bribe
304.article_body: A 34-year-old constable from Pune Police's Crime Branch has been arrested along with a 27-year-old civilian for allegedly seeking a bribe of ₹2 lakh. He sought the bribe in exchange for not making a mobile shop owner an accused in a case of buying stolen cell phones. Following a complaint, the Anti-Corruption Bureau caught the constable's accomplice accepting money.

305.title: E-commerce startup Flash, founded by ex-Flipkart Senior VP, raises $5.8 mn
305.article_body: E-commerce startup Flash, founded by former Flipkart Senior Vice President Ranjith Boyanapalli, has secured $5.8 million in a seed funding round. The round was led by Global Founders Capital and White Venture Capital, among others. Several angel investors including Flipkart Co-founder Binny Bansal, CRED Founder Kunal Shah and Udaan Co-founder Sujeet Kumar also participated in the round.

306.title: COVID-19 vaccine trials improved diversity recruiting: Moderna scientist
306.article_body: Moderna's top scientist Paul Burton said the company has learned how to make better recruitments from diverse populations for its clinical trials from running its COVID-19 vaccine studies. "To get good uptake...you need to have representation of all sorts of people," Burton said, adding the company was eventually able to enrol 37% of its 35,000-person trial from communities of colour.

307.title: No point threatening Messi, fight me: UFC fighter Santiago to boxer Alvarez
307.article_body: Reacting to Mexican world champion boxer Canelo Alvarez threatening Lionel Messi for allegedly disrespecting the Mexican flag, UFC fighter Santiago Ponzinibbio said, "No point threatening Messi." "If Canelo doesn't know, he shouldn't say a thing...If he wants to fight, I am ready...Don't bother Messi," added Ponzinibbio. "You mess with Messi, you mess with...entire Argentina," he stated.

308.title: Man grabs Korean YouTuber's hand, tries to kiss her during livestream on Mumbai road
308.article_body: A man was seen harassing a 24-year-old Korean YouTuber on a street in Mumbai in a video posted on Twitter. It shows the man offering the woman a lift, grabbing her hand and pulling her after she refuses. He also tried to kiss her while she pulled away. Police replied to the video, asking the woman to share her contact.

309.title: Mumbai man assaults 60-year-old for calling his pet dog 'kutta'
309.article_body: A 25-year-old Mumbai man allegedly assaulted a 60-year-old autorickshaw driver for calling his pet dog a 'kutta'. The victim said the accused told him to call the dog by her name, Lucy, and started kicking his autorickshaw. The victim further said that the accused held his collar, threatened to kill him and punched him in the face, leaving him bleeding.

310.title: Traffic on Pune's old Katraj Ghat road to become one-way from Dec 3
310.article_body: Pune District Collector Rajesh Deshmukh has issued an order for making the old Katraj Ghat road a one-way commute amid maintenance work. Traffic from Satara to Pune will be diverted to the new Katraj tunnel road from December 3 and this will likely be in effect till the end of this year. The old Katraj ghat road is being relayed.

311.title: UK's Prince William's godmother resigns over comments to black charity boss
311.article_body: Lady Susan Hussey, the godmother of UK's Prince William has resigned from her honorary duties at Buckingham Palace after she asked racially offensive questions to a black charity boss. Ngozi Fulani, founder of Britain's leading domestic abuse charity for black women, said she was left "traumatised". Lady Susan served late Queen Elizabeth for more than 60 years.

312.title: HC stays 'one family, one dog' rule, removal of strays in Gurugram
312.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court on Wednesday stayed a district consumer court's order which directed Gurugram administration and civic body to impose a 'one family, one dog' rule and to impound all stray dogs from the streets. The court was acting on the plea of two residents, one of whom argued that the order restrained her from keeping another dog.

313.title: We must use new advanced weapons in Ukraine: Russian Defence Minister
313.article_body: Russian armed forces should use new advanced weapons systems in Ukraine, Russia's Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu said. "It's necessary to continue the modernisation and creation of promising systems with their subsequent use during the special military operation," Shoigu told senior Russian generals at a meeting. He added that Russia should find new ways to improve artillery and missile attacks.

314.title: Argentina defeat Poland 2-0, reach FIFA World Cup round of 16 for 5th straight time
314.article_body: Argentina defeated Poland 2-0 in their last Group C stage match to qualify for FIFA World Cup round of 16 for the fifth straight time. Alexis Mac Allister and Julián Álvarez scored for Argentina in second half, while Lionel Messi missed a penalty in first half. Poland also advanced from Group C for having better goal difference than Mexico.

315.title: Voting begins for 89 seats in 1st phase of Gujarat Assembly elections
315.article_body: Voting for 89 seats in Gujarat began at 8 am in the first phase of the Gujarat Assembly polls on Thursday. Voting will continue till 5 pm across 14,382 polling stations, the office of the state Chief Electoral Officer said. The 89 seats are spread across 19 districts of Kutch and Saurashtra region and the southern part of the state.

316.title: Redevelopment will kill Dharavi's identity, destroy small-scale business: Residents
316.article_body: After Adani Group bagged the redevelopment project of Dharavi, the biggest slum in Mumbai, residents believe the project would kill Dharavi's identity. The redevelopment will destroy small businesses that Dharavi is known for, they said, adding that they're content with the way things are at present. They also said they are uncertain about what they'll be offered after redevelopment.

317.title: Move in style like Kartik Aaryan with official FIFA Collection: Skybags
317.article_body: Skybags launched India's first official FIFA-licensed luggage range with Kartik Aaryan as the brand ambassador, the brand shared. Skybags urges you to step up your style game this football season with three distinct and dynamic designs from the range, which aim to tap into desires of young travellers and football fans wanting to showcase their authentic selves through their styles.

318.title: 30th-ranked Tunisia hand defending champs France their 1st defeat in 2022 FIFA WC
318.article_body: Tunisia, who are ranked 30th in the world, defeated defending champions France 1-0 in their last Group D match. This is France's first defeat in World Cup since the 2014 edition. Despite their victory, Tunisia failed to reach the knockout stage. France and Australia advanced from Group D, while Tunisia and Denmark were eliminated.

319.title: Climate activists deflate tyres of 900 SUVs in 8 countries in one night
319.article_body: A group of climate activists, called 'The Tyre Extinguishers', deflated the tyres of nearly 900 "polluting" SUVs in one night in eight countries. They deflated the tyres of SUVs in the UK, Switzerland, Germany, France, Sweden, the US, Austria and the Netherlands. "We want to live in towns and cities with clean air and safe streets," the group says.

320.title: Washington Sundar forgets where India's 3rd ODI against NZ was, video goes viral
320.article_body: Team India all-rounder Washington Sundar, during an interview after the third ODI against New Zealand, forgot where India's third ODI was taking place. Talking about weather conditions, Washington said, "Definitely...playing for Lancashire in Manchester was very cold. Very similar to...Where are we?" to which Murali Kartik, who was taking his interview, said, "We are in Christchurch."

321.title: Twitter has interfered in elections, tweets Elon Musk
321.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk on Wednesday tweeted, "The obvious reality, as long-time users know, is that Twitter has failed in trust & safety for a very long time and has interfered in elections." He added, "Twitter 2.0 will be far more effective, transparent and even-handed." He tweeted this after a user said that Twitter has lost users' trust.

322.title: Indians working abroad to send home record $100 bn this year: World Bank
322.article_body: Migrant workers from India are set to send home over $100 billion in yearly remittances this year, a World Bank report said. It's for the first time a single country is on track to receive over $100 billion in yearly remittances. Remittances to India were enhanced by wage hikes and strong labour market in the US and other OECD countries.

323.title: I grieve for a friend from my school & college days: Mahindra on Kirloskar's death
323.article_body: Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra on Wednesday mourned the demise of Toyota Kirloskar Motor Vice Chairman Vikram Kirloskar, who passed away at 64 after suffering a heart attack. "I grieve for a friend from my school & college days...But above all, I treasure the memory of a warm human being who always had a smile on his face," tweeted Mahindra.

324.title: Crypto exchange Kraken lays off 1,100 employees
324.article_body: Kraken, the world's third-largest crypto exchange by volume, said on Wednesday that it would lay off about 1,100 employees or 30% of its global workforce. CEO Jesse Powell said that slowing growth, prompted by "macroeconomic and geopolitical factors", had muted customer demand. "This reduction takes our team size back to where it was only 12 months ago," Powell added.

325.title: EU seeks UN-backed court to probe alleged Russian war crimes
325.article_body: The European Union (EU) on Wednesday proposed to form a special UN-backed court to probe alleged war crimes committed by Russia in Ukraine. European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen also said sanctioned Russian assets must be used to rebuild Ukraine. She said the estimated value of damage in Ukraine due to the Russian invasion is €600 billion ($619 billion).

326.title: Employee at Ukraine's Madrid embassy injured after opening letter bomb
326.article_body: An employee at the Ukrainian embassy in Madrid was injured on Wednesday after he opened a letter bomb addressed to the ambassador. "During a check, the envelope exploded in the hands of the embassy's manager," said Ukrainian Foreign Ministry spokesman Oleh Nikolenko. The manager received light injuries and was hospitalised. No other embassy employee was hurt.

327.title: Foundation stone laid for India's 1st int'l Buddhist university in Tripura
327.article_body: The foundation stone for India's first international Buddhist university was laid in Tripura's Sabroom on Tuesday. Shakya Gasan, the chief monk of South Korea's World Buddhist Pope Organisation, laid the foundation stone of Dhamma Dipa International Buddhist University (DDIBU) in the presence of delegates from seven countries. Dalai Lama could not attend the programme due to health issues.

328.title: It's a good thing if Apple is looking at Twitter's content: US Treasury Secy
328.article_body: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen on Wednesday said she believes it was appropriate for Apple to demand certain content standards from Twitter. "I think it's a good thing if Apple is looking at the content," she said. This came after Twitter CEO Elon Musk on Monday accused Apple of threatening to block Twitter from its App Store.

329.title: Apple acts in self interest, doesn’t care about the law: Spotify CEO
329.article_body: Spotify CEO Daniel Ek claimed Apple indulged in anti-competitive practices a day after Elon Musk criticised the iPhone maker for charging software developers, including Twitter, for in-app purchases. Ek alleged that Apple acts in self-interest without caring about the law, and added that it "gives itself every advantage while at the same time stifling innovation and hurting consumers".

330.title: SpaceX accused of age discrimination by 62-year-old ex-employee
330.article_body: A 62-year-old former SpaceX engineer, who joined the Elon Musk-led company in 2018, said he faced age discrimination there. John Johnson said once a manager told a younger engineer to "shadow" him in case he "might retire or die". "I saw my work roles gradually transferred to younger engineers who fit the company's 'frat bro' mould," Johnson added.

331.title: Call Akhilesh 'Chhote Netaji': Shivpal Yadav to people of Mainpuri
331.article_body: Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party (Lohia) founder Shivpal Singh Yadav on Wednesday asked the people of Mainpuri to call his nephew and Samajwadi Party leader Akhilesh Yadav "Chhote Netaji". Earlier, Akhilesh had said there's no leader like Mulayam Singh Yadav, who was called "Netaji" by people. Shivpal Yadav is campaigning for Akhilesh's wife Dimple Yadav for Mainpuri by-elections in Uttar Pradesh.

332.title: Kejriwal showed true form by lathicharging protesting farm workers: BJP
332.article_body: BJP leader Manjinder Singh Sirsa on Wednesday said AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal showed his true form by lathicharging protesting farm workers in front of Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's house. "Instead of giving farmers their rights, Kejriwal is weakening Punjab by investing state's money in Gujarat poll campaigning," Sirsa said. "Punjabis will give befitting reply to Kejriwal's injustice," he added.

333.title: BSF camel contingent to include women for 1st time on Republic Day
333.article_body: The Border Security Force's (BSF's) camel contingent will include women for the first time at the 2023 Republic Day parade with male counterparts, an officer said. The contingent has been part of the Republic Day parade since 1976. "This is an indicator of the increasing role of our women personnel in various duties," BSF Director General Pankaj Kumar Singh said.

334.title: Anti-drone guns deployed for security of VIPs at Gujarat rallies
334.article_body: Anti-drone guns were deployed for security of VIPs at election rallies in Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh. Last Thursday, a drone was taken down at a Prime Minister Narendra Modi's rally in Gujarat. A senior official of the National Security Guard (NSG) said that they used anti-drone guns before the Uttar Pradesh assembly elections to protect VIPs from aerial attacks.

335.title: We have faith in the highest court of India: Bilkis Bano's husband
335.article_body: Bilkis Bano's husband Yakub Rasool on Wednesday said they've faith in the highest court of India. This comes after Bano approached the Supreme Court, challenging the early release of 11 men convicted of raping her and killing her family members during the 2002 Gujarat riots. Rasool said the Supreme Court has done justice before and it would do justice again.

336.title: I was beaten for being a mixed-race kid: Scotland Yard's Neil Basu
336.article_body: The Scotland Yard's senior-most Indian-origin officer, Neil Basu, has spoken out against racism, recounting how as a schoolboy he faced racist attacks. In an interview with 'Channel 4 News' on Tuesday, Basu expressed concern over the lack of stringent action to clamp down on racism. "I was beaten in the 1970s for being a mixed-race kid," he said.

337.title: Drugs, liquor and cash worth ₹290 cr seized in Gujarat ahead of polls
337.article_body: Drugs, liquor, cash and freebies worth ₹290 crore were seized in Gujarat ahead of the upcoming assembly elections. As of November 29, the total seizures stood at ₹290.24 crore, 10.66 times that of seizures in 2017. Officers from the Anti-Terror Squad (ATS) also discovered roughly 143 kg of mephedrone worth nearly ₹478 crore and discovered two mephedrone drug manufacturing facilities.

338.title: French baguette gets UNESCO cultural heritage status
338.article_body: French baguette was added to the UNESCO's intangible heritage list, the organisation announced on Wednesday. "Baguettes require specific knowledge and techniques...they also generate modes of consumption and social practices that differentiate them from other types of bread," the UNESCO stated. Over 6 billion baguettes are baked annually, the National Federation of French Bakeries has claimed.

339.title: 6 sitting Nepali ministers lose Parliament seats in elections
339.article_body: Six sitting ministers of the Nepali government have lost elections to the country's House of Representatives. The Nepali Congress' Balkrishna Khand (Home Minister), Umakanta Chaudhary (Water Supply Minister) and Umesh Shrestha (Minister of State for PMO) have lost the polls. The other ministers to have lost are Pampha Bhusal, Maheshwor Jung Gahatraj and Jeevan Ram Shrestha.

340.title: 10 children killed as bomb targets religious school in Afghanistan
340.article_body: At least 10 children died in a bomb blast at a religious school in Afghanistan's northern Samangan province on Wednesday, a Taliban official said. The explosion occurred around the time of afternoon prayers at Al Jihad Madrassa. Abdul Nafi Takor, a spokesperson in the Taliban regime, said many students were injured in the attack.

341.title: CNN informs employees that layoffs are underway: Memo
341.article_body: CNN CEO Chris Licht informed employees that layoffs are underway, as part of continued cost-cutting by parent company Warner Bros Discovery. In an all-staff memo, Licht said the channel would notify a limited number of individuals, largely some of its paid contributors, on Wednesday and the impacted employees on Thursday. "It will be a difficult time for everyone," Licht wrote.

342.title: Portugal defeat Ghana 3-2 in 2022 FIFA World Cup as Ronaldo breaks world record
342.article_body: Portugal defeated Ghana 3-2 in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener on Thursday. With his goal in the 65th minute of the match, Cristiano Ronaldo set the world record for scoring in most World Cups (five). João Félix and Rafael Leão scored the remaining two goals for Portugal, while André Ayew and Osman Bukari scored for Ghana.

343.title: PNB gets govt's nod to sell its stake in UTI Asset Management
343.article_body: Punjab National Bank has received the central government's approval to sell its stake in UTI Asset Management Company in one or multiple tranches. The bank currently holds a 15.22% stake in the company, according to the bank's exchange filing. PNB will sell a portion of its stake or the entirety of it to realise gains from its investment.

344.title: Ronaldo creates history, becomes first man to score at 5 FIFA World Cups
344.article_body: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo on Thursday created history by becoming the first man to score at five FIFA World Cups. The 37-year-old achieved the feat by opening the scoring for Portugal by converting a penalty in the 65th minute in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener against Ghana. Ronaldo earlier scored in the 2006, 2010, 2014 and 2018 editions.

345.title: BJP Councillor Shailu Kushwaha murdered in Gwalior, 1 arrested
345.article_body: BJP Councillor Shailendra alias Shailu Kushwaha was murdered on Thursday in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior. Police said the 40-year-old was beaten to death by his friends after he went to a neighbouring house for a birthday party. The partygoers had reportedly consumed alcohol before a fight ensued. Police have arrested one person, while efforts are on to catch the remaining accused.

346.title: Massive fire breaks out at Bhagirath Palace market in Delhi's Chandni Chowk
346.article_body: A massive fire has broken out in shops of Bhagirath Palace electronic market in Delhi's Chandni Chowk. While the reason for the fire is yet unknown, around 20 fire tenders have been rushed to the spot to douse the flames after the fire department received a call regarding the fire at 9:20 pm. No casualties have yet been reported.
