347.title: Gehlot's differences with Pilot to be resolved in way that strengthens us: Cong
347.article_body: Congress' Jairam Ramesh has said Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot's differences with party leader Sachin Pilot should be resolved in a manner that strengthens Congress. "Right now it is the duty of each and every [party worker] to make...Bharat Jodo Yatra...impactful in north Indian states," Ramesh added. Gehlot recently called Pilot a "traitor" and stated that Pilot cannot be made CM.

348.title: UK PM Sunak, wife Akshata Murty debut on 'Asian Rich List 2022' in UK
348.article_body: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and his wife, Akshata Murty, have made their debut on the UK's 'Asian Rich List 2022'. Sunak and his wife are ranked 17th on the list, with an estimated wealth of £790 million. The list is topped by the Hinduja family for the eighth consecutive time, with an estimated wealth of £30.5 billion.

349.title: FHRAI seeks infra tag for hospitality industry, meets FM Sitharaman
349.article_body: The Federation of Hotel & Restaurant Associations of India (FHRAI) representatives on Thursday met Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and sought granting of infrastructure status to the hospitality industry in the upcoming Budget. The association has requested that the threshold to accord infrastructure status be brought down to ₹10 crore from ₹200 crore to give a fillip to budget segment hotels.

350.title: Tata Sons Chairman tells entrepreneurs to focus on cash flow, not valuation
350.article_body: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran advised young entrepreneurs to concentrate on steady cash flows and not chase valuations. Speaking at the Ascent Conclave, Chandrasekaran said every business has to be essentially a cash flow-run enterprise and "it is over" if there is an absence of it. He said building a purpose-led organisation makes a company successful.

351.title: Big B's 18-yr-old co-star from Jhund arrested for theft of jewellery, cash worth ₹5 lakh
351.article_body: Priyanshu Kshatriya, 18,  who played a prominent role in Amitabh Bachchan-starrer 'Jhund', has been arrested for alleged theft, said police. Pradeep Mondawe, a resident of Mankapur area, had filed a complaint about theft of jewellery and cash worth ₹5 lakh from his house. Priyanshu was produced before a court which remanded him in police custody till November 25.

352.title: Just Eat Takeaway plans to reduce 170 jobs, mostly in UK: Reports
352.article_body: Amsterdam-based online food delivery marketplace Just Eat Takeaway plans to cut 170 customer service jobs, mostly in UK, a Dutch newspaper reported citing an internal memo. The report added Just Eat would close a customer service centre in Borehamwood, and employees would be offered work at Sunderland. The reorganisation would help the company "on way to profitability", the memo read.

353.title: IAS officer accused of mentally harassing PA in Odisha, FIR lodged
353.article_body: An FIR has been lodged against Odisha's Khordha District Collector K Sudarshan Chakravarthy after his Personal Assistant (PA) Hemant Kumar accused him of mental harassment. Kumar alleged that Chakravarthy has been making racist and casteist remarks against him. "My husband has been...harassed...(Chakravarthy) is [treating] my husband like a peon, sweeper and gatekeeper," Kumar's wife alleged.

354.title: Zimbabwe Prez calls Beijing-gifted new Parliament building 'majestic'
354.article_body: Zimbabwean President Emmerson Mnangagwa has hailed "excellent" ties with China while delivering a State of the Nation address from the new Parliament building which Beijing has "gifted" to the African country. The $200 million building in Mt Hampden, around 18 km west of capital Harare, has been funded and constructed by China. Mnangagwa described the building as 'majestic'.

355.title: IFS officer shares pic of Pope's Green Viper snake, says 'Some think it is unreal'
355.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan took to Twitter to share picture of a Pope's Green Viper snake. He stated that some people think the picture is unreal. He added, "Green vipers come in many species and it’s difficult to identify them by picture until you have not seen them from close. They are very photogenic...remain in same pose for long time."

356.title: Unique deep-sea creatures found in depths of Indian ocean, pics released
356.article_body: Museums Victoria Research Institute's researchers discovered 'bizarre' sea creatures, including eels with no eyes, bat-like fish, and a lizard fish with both ovaries and testes in the submerged volcanoes of Indian Ocean. These creatures were discovered during expedition to Australia's Cocos Islands Marine Park. "We've discovered...amazing number of potentially new species," a scientist stated.

357.title: Horrible: Priyanka Chopra on claims she worships Devil for success
357.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra, in an interview with YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia, was asked about claims that she's a Satanic worshipper for her success. Reacting to this, Priyanka said, "Horrible! Shiv ji will be very upset with me." The actress will next feature in the Bollywood film 'Jee Le Zaraa', which will be directed by Farhan Akhtar.

358.title: Will start filming 'Aarya 3' in two months: Sikandar Kher
358.article_body: Actor Sikandar Kher revealed they will start filming 'Aarya 3' in two months. Sikandar, who plays Daulat in the series, added it's challenging to play the same character due to long gaps between the seasons. "The first time I experienced that was while shooting for 'Aarya 2'. It took me one or two days to play Daulat again," he stated.

359.title: Police booth, vehicles attacked in Shillong during protest against Nov 22 violence
359.article_body: Miscreants on Thursday torched a traffic police booth and attacked three vehicles, including a city bus, in Shillong during a candlelight vigil organised to protest against violence on the Assam-Meghalaya border. Security personnel were forced to lob tear gas shells to disperse protesters, reports said. On November 22, six persons were killed in firing incident in Meghalaya's West Jaintia Hills.

360.title: French lawmakers adopt resolution to guarantee abortion rights
360.article_body: A resolution to incorporate abortion rights in France's Constitution was adopted by lawmakers in the country's Lower House of Parliament on Thursday. The resolution was approved with 337 lawmakers voting for it in the National Assembly of 557 members. Abortion was decriminalised in France in 1975 but there is no provision in the Constitution that guarantees abortion rights.

361.title: Police are doing their duty & I'm doing mine: Aftab Poonawala's lawyer
361.article_body: Reacting to the impending narco-analysis and polygraph test of Aftab Poonawala in Shraddha Walkar murder probe, his court-appointed defence counsel, Avinash Kumar, said the police are doing their duty as he's doing his. "[Aftab] told me that he will fully cooperate. So, whenever I move for bail, it will be good grounds for me to state the same," Kumar added.

362.title: 1,800 children expelled by Dominican Republic to Haiti: UNICEF
362.article_body: The Dominican Republic has expelled at least 1,800 Haitian unaccompanied migrant children this year, the UNICEF said. The Dominican Republic has denied the charge. Illegal immigration from Haiti has increased in recent months following a cholera outbreak and gang violence in the country. The crisis in Haiti has worsened after President Jovenel Moise was assassinated in 2021.

363.title: Religious rings, thread on wrist, neck and ankle not permitted: Air India to its crew
363.article_body: Tata group-owned Air India issued new guidelines on grooming for its male and female cabin crew, which stated, "Black and religious thread on wrist, neck and ankle are strictly not permitted." Religious rings with coloured stones and pearls, neck jewellery, along with thumb rings, are also not permitted. The airline also told the crew not to have grey hair.

364.title: 200 cities will be 5G enabled by April 2023: IT Minister Vaishnaw
364.article_body: IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Thursday said that 200 cities will be 5G enabled by March-April 2023. "The rollout is in full swing, 2,500 5G towers are being deployed every week," Vaishnaw noted. He added that complete 5G rollout in any country across the world takes 3-4 years, while India plans to achieve that target in 2 years.

365.title: SBI to consider raising ₹10,000 cr via infrastructure bonds in FY23
365.article_body: State Bank of India (SBI) on Thursday said it would consider raising funds by issuing up to ₹10,000 crore of infrastructure bonds. The executive committee of the central board of the bank will meet on November 29 to consider the fundraising, SBI said. The fundraising, if approved, would be through a public issue or private placement during fiscal 2023.

366.title: Policybazaar sells 1.5% stake to WF Asian Smaller Companies Fund for ₹271 cr
366.article_body: WF Asian Smaller Companies Fund bought a 1.5% stake worth ₹271 crore in PB Fintech, the operator of Policybazaar and Paisabazaar, via open market transactions. The Ward Ferry Management-operated fund has bought 67.75 lakh shares at ₹400 apiece. As per bulk deals data, the fund has purchased 34.21 lakh shares on the NSE and 33.53 lakh shares on the BSE.

367.title: Richa Chadha can't mock Army & get away with sorry: Ashoke Pandit
367.article_body: Filmmaker Ashoke Pandit has filed a complaint against actress Richa Chadha at the Juhu Police Station in Mumbai over her insulting tweet on the Indian Army. "This attitude of a responsible citizen to...mock our security forces is not done...She can't say anything...later say sorry about it," he stated. Ashoke urged that Richa should be punished according to the law.

368.title: Biased, inaccurate: India on US body's religious freedom report
368.article_body: The latest report by United States Commission on International Religious Freedom (USCIRF) was called biased and inaccurate by Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Arindam Bagchi on Thursday. "USCIRF is guided by...prejudices," he added. The report claimed religious freedom conditions in India "remained poor" this year. It also cited arrests of journalists Mohammed Zubair and Siddique Kappan.

369.title: Amazon faces Black Friday protests in 40 countries including India
369.article_body: Thousands of Amazon warehouse workers across about 40 countries, including India, are planning to stage protests during Black Friday sales. Employees are demanding better wages and working conditions amid the cost-of-living crisis in the 'Make Amazon Pay' campaign. The campaign is being coordinated by an international coalition of trade unions alongside environmental and civil society groups.

370.title: Ukraine should meet Russian demands to 'end suffering': Kremlin
370.article_body: Russia on Thursday said Ukraine could "end the suffering" of its people by meeting the demands of the Kremlin. Repeated missile strikes on power infrastructure across Ukraine in the past few weeks have left many parts of the country without electricity as early winter sets in. The Kremlin has denied that the strikes were aimed at civilians.

371.title: Ronaldo tears up during Portugal's national anthem, pic goes viral
371.article_body: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo got emotional while his country's national anthem was being played ahead of their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener against Ghana. A picture of Ronaldo tearing up has gone viral on social media. Ronaldo is featuring in his fifth FIFA World Cup. Recently, Ronaldo and Manchester United parted ways following Ronaldo's controversial interview with Piers Morgan.

372.title: Baba Ramdev should stop using Patanjali as brand name: BJP MP
372.article_body: BJP leader Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh demanded that Baba Ramdev and Balakrishna should stop using Patanjali as their brand name. He said they built a business empire by following Maharishi Patanjali's path but did nothing for his birthplace in Uttar Pradesh's Gonda district. "Is it appropriate...to do business of ghee, oil, soap, spices, underwear, pants in his name?" he added.

373.title: Indians overtake Chinese as largest foreign students group in UK
373.article_body: Indian students have overtaken their Chinese counterparts for the first time to become the largest group of foreign students studying in the UK, said the UK Home Office. "There were 127,731 [study visa] grants to main applicant Indian nationals in the year ending September 2022, an increase of 93,470 (273%) compared to 2019," the Home Office said, explaining the development.

374.title: MCD elections to be held from 8 am-5:30 pm on Dec 4; results on Dec 7
374.article_body: Delhi's State Election Commission has announced that polls for Municipal Corporation of Delhi's (MCD) 250 wards will be held from 8 am to 5:30 pm on December 4. Polls' results will be declared on December 7. The total number of MCD wards has been reduced from 272 to 250 this year, with 42 seats reserved for Scheduled Caste (SC) candidates.

375.title: Rahul spoiling Indian culture, Gehlot should get him married: RLP chief
375.article_body: Rashtriya Loktantrik Party (RLP) chief Hanuman Beniwal said Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot should get Congress MP Rahul Gandhi married, claiming that Gandhi is spoiling Indian culture. His comments come amid Congress' ongoing Bharat Jodo Yatra, which is currently passing through Madhya Pradesh. Beniwal made the remarks while campaigning in support of Lalchand Mood for the Sardarshahar by-poll.

376.title: 2 women Maoists with ₹4 lakh reward each killed in encounter in Odisha
376.article_body: Two women Maoists, carrying a reward of ₹4 lakh each, were killed in an encounter with the Special Operation Group (SOG) of Odisha Police in Balangir district on Thursday. "Around 10:30 am, we could see the movement of four or five Maoists and there was immediate exchange of fire," DGP SK Bansal said, adding two INSAS rifles were recovered.

377.title: Iran is 'in a full-fledged human rights crisis': UN rights chief
377.article_body: United Nations Human Rights chief Volker Turk on Thursday said Iran is "in a full-fledged human rights crisis". "From what we could gather, around 14,000 people, including children, have so far been arrested (for the protests)...this is a staggering number," he said. Iranian protesters are agitating for months now over the alleged death of a woman in police custody.

378.title: Dog in US named world's oldest by Guinness World Records, pics surface
378.article_body: A California dog is now believed to be the "world's oldest", according to Guinness World Records. Gino, a 22-year-old Chihuahua from Los Angeles, was verified to be the oldest living dog on November 15. He was born on September 24, 2000. Gino was adopted by Alex Wolf in Boulder, Colorado, in 2002.

379.title: Was lovely working with Kamal Sadanah again in 'Salaam Venky': Kajol
379.article_body: Actress Kajol has said that it was "lovely" working with actor Kamal Sadanah again in 'Salaam Venky'. Kajol reunited with Kamal after they worked in the 1992 film 'Bekhudi', which was also Kajol's debut film. Speaking about being surprised to see Kamal on 'Salaam Venky' sets, Kajol said, "I kept screaming. It was just really nice."

380.title: Dengue fever kills 26 people in Sudan: Officials
380.article_body: Dengue fever has claimed 26 lives in Sudan this season, making it one of the worst outbreaks in the country in recent years, local health officials said. About 20 deaths have been recorded in Kordofan region. The Sudanese Health Ministry said as of Monday there were 3,436 suspected dengue cases in the country, of which 460 cases were confirmed.

381.title: Canadian woman's reaction on seeing her son play in FIFA World Cup goes viral
381.article_body: A video of Canadian footballer Sam Adekugbe's mother Dee Adekugbe's reaction seeing her son play in 2022 FIFA World Cup went viral. In the video, she can be seen jumping in joy and saying, "My son is in the World Cup. Thank you, Jesus. Hallelujah." Canada opened their 2022 FIFA World Cup campaign with a 0-1 defeat against Belgium.

382.title: Iran arrests football player for criticising government
382.article_body: Iranian footballer Voria Ghafouri has been arrested for criticising his country's government. Ghafouri, who isn't a part of Iran's 2022 FIFA World Cup squad, has been accused of insulting the Iranian national football team and criticising the government. Ghafouri, who is a member of Iran’s Kurdish minority, is known to have criticised Iran government's policies in the past as well.

383.title: Ford recalls over 6 lakh SUVs worldwide over fire risks
383.article_body: American automobile maker Ford Motor Company is recalling 6,34,000 sport utility vehicles (SUVs) worldwide over fire risks. "When the engine is operating, a cracked fuel injector could cause fuel and/or fuel vapour to accumulate near hot surfaces, resulting in a potential under-hood fire," Ford said. The recall affects the 2020-2023 MY Bronco Sport and Escapes with 3-cylinder, 1.5-litre engines.

384.title: B'luru law student recorded 1,200 images, videos of semi-naked women
384.article_body: A 21-year-old law student from a private college in Bengaluru, who was arrested for peeping inside a girls' toilet, recorded over 1,200 videos and images of semi-naked girls. He's also accused of clicking nude photographs of his girlfriends. He had placed a hidden camera in the toilet to record videos. He fled after some girls caught him repairing the camera.

385.title: Putin warns of 'grave consequences' to oil price caps by Western countries
385.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin during a call with Iraq's PM warned that the oil price caps the Western countries plan to introduce could have "grave consequences" for energy markets. "Such actions are contrary to the principles of market relations," Putin said. On a proposed price cap on Russian oil, US President Joe Biden on Thursday said, "It's in play."

386.title: 60 families rescued as massive landslide hits Sikkim's Pathing village
386.article_body: At least 60 families were rescued after a massive landslide hit South Sikkim's Pathing village, officials said on Thursday. The affected families were shifted to Pathing Junior High School where a relief camp has been set up, officials said. Debris from the landslide has littered the farmland below, destroying crops ready for harvest, a villager at the relief camp said.

387.title: US using Islamabad like 'hired gun': Former Pak PM Imran Khan
387.article_body: Former Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan has said that the US was using Islamabad like a "hired gun" in its war against terror. He said America's ties with Pakistan are "very undignified", while the US' relationship with India is a very "civilised relationship". Khan was removed from the Prime Minister's Office earlier in the year.

388.title: Doctors refuse to touch HIV positive pregnant woman in UP hospital, she loses her child
388.article_body: A 20-year-old pregnant woman was denied treatment at a hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad district as doctors allegedly refused to touch her because she was HIV positive. The medical negligence led to the woman losing her child hours after birth. A complaint has been lodged by the woman's family, an official said.

389.title: 211 crorepatis to contest in first phase of Gujarat polls: Report
389.article_body: Out of the 788 candidates contesting in the first phase of Gujarat Assembly elections, 211 are crorepatis, a report by Association for Democratic Reforms revealed. The BJP has the highest number of such candidates, with 79 having assets above ₹1 crore. Meanwhile, 65 Congress candidates are crorepatis. BJP's Ramesh Tilara, with declared assets worth ₹175 crore, is the richest candidate.

390.title: SRK thought I'd fly off train during 'Chaiyya...': Malaika Arora
390.article_body: Malaika Arora, who featured in the song 'Chaiyya Chaiyya', revealed everyone was harnessed while filming the song on the train except for her and Shah Rukh Khan. "SRK insisted I should be (harnessed) because he was worried that I might fly off the train," she added. Malaika said she was not harnessed as it would have been difficult to dance.

391.title: My choices have been wrong so audience disappeared on me: Suniel Shetty
391.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty said he had made some wrong choices and so his audience disappeared on him. "Now, I'm trying to reinvent and make sure I play roles that suit me, I'm 61, and I'll play such roles," Shetty said. "I don't have the excitement to do more films. But, I'm still committed as an actor," he added.

392.title: Children's shelter director rapes 14-yr-old girl in Maha; arrested
392.article_body: The director of a private facility for children in Maharashtra's Nashik district has been arrested for allegedly raping a 14-year-old girl, a police official said on Thursday. The 28-year-old took the victim to a makeshift tin room in the parking area of the building, made her watch an obscene video and then raped her, he added.

393.title: Gehlot calls me nikamma, gaddar, defies my upbringing to use such words: Pilot
393.article_body: After Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot called Sachin Pilot a "gaddar" (traitor), the congress leader said it was unbecoming of an experienced person like Gehlot to use such language. Pilot said Gehlot has been calling him "nikamma, naakara", but it wasn't part of his upbringing to use such language. The priority should be to fight unitedly to defeat BJP, Pilot said.

394.title: Recall 'Amazon parcel' or send him to old age home: Uddhav on Maha Guv
394.article_body: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Thursday described Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari as a "parcel" sent via Amazon by the Centre and demanded his recall over his remark on Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. "Take this sample back or send him to an old age home. Such a slip of tongue cannot happen every time," Thackeray said.

395.title: No one should even dream that CAA will not be implemented: Amit Shah
395.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah said that no one should even dream that Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) will not be implemented. "Those who think like that are mistaken," he added. "CAA, NRC hasn't been put in...cold storage. CAA is a law...It cannot be changed now...We've to frame rules...these got delayed due to COVID-19 but the work will soon begin," Shah stated.

396.title: Wasim Jaffer names his Team India XI for first ODI against New Zealand
396.article_body: Ahead of Team India's first ODI against New Zealand on Friday, former India batter Wasim Jaffer named his Team India XI. He included captain Shikhar Dhawan and Shubman Gill as openers, followed by Shreyas Iyer, Rishabh Pant, Suryakumar Yadav, Deepak Hooda, Washington Sundar, Shardul Thakur, Deepak Chahar, Arshdeep Singh and Umran Malik.

397.title: Diamonds are a sham: Zerodha's billionaire Co-founder Nikhil Kamath
397.article_body: Zerodha's billionaire Co-founder Nikhil Kamath on Thursday tweeted, "Without sugar-coating stuff, diamonds are a sham, don't fall prey to well-thought-out marketing campaigns." Citing research, Kamath added, "If a lab-grown diamond is indistinguishable to a jeweller and costs 1/10th, logic will eventually catch up." The research shared by Kamath claimed that, unlike gold, diamonds are not rare.

398.title: Gay characters have been stereotyped in B'wood over the years: Pranay
398.article_body: Actor Pranay Manchanda, who played a gay doctor in the film 'Tara Vs Bilal', has said that "gay characters" in Hindi cinema have been portrayed in a stereotypical manner over the years. Speaking about 'Tara Vs Bilal', Pranay stated, "What this film has done beautifully with my character is, it has presented it as a fully fleshed-out character."

399.title: We're figuring out things: Suniel Shetty on KL Rahul-Athiya's wedding
399.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty said he's aware of the rumours about his daughter Athiya Shetty and India cricketer KL Rahul's wedding. "I can tell you that I'm looking at it as in the date. With both their schedules and stuff like that, we're figuring out things," he added. Earlier, Suniel had confirmed the wedding and had said it'll happen very soon.

400.title: Akhilesh Yadav hints at contesting 2024 Lok Sabha polls from Kannauj
400.article_body: Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav on Thursday hinted that he may contest the 2024 Lok Sabha elections from Uttar Pradesh's Kannauj. "I'll contest from where I had contested the first election," he stated. However, he said the party would take a decision regarding the matter at the right time. Notably, his wife Dimple Yadav has served as Kannauj MP twice.

401.title: I hope to find scripts that do me justice: Celina Jaitly
401.article_body: Actress Celina Jaitly has said that the success of her short film 'Season's Greetings' amid the COVID-19 pandemic has "encouraged" her to return to cinema. "The only issue is there are not enough scripts that are unique and unusual just like 'Season's Greetings'...I hope to find scripts that do me justice," she further added.

402.title: Man accused of molesting minor let off with 5 sit-ups by local panchayat in Bihar
402.article_body: A man accused of molestation was let off with five sit-ups by the panchayat in Bihar's Nawada district. The accused allegedly took a minor girl to his poultry farm on pretext of giving chocolates and touched her inappropriately. The panchayat, however, concluded he was innocent and found him guilty of only taking the girl to secluded spot for unknown reasons.
